text: Trübes Gold mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, süßlich, etwas Honig, hefig, leicht fruchtig, Orange, Pfirsich, leicht herb.

the aroma is fruity and malty with hints of sweet citrus, peach, apricot, yeast and some spices... the taste is malty and fruity with notes of dry wine, sweet orange, yeast, candy and some herbs... sweet, bitter and rather dry aftertaste...
Yellow/brown. Cloudy. Lots of fruit in the aroma, prunes. Rich, complex taste. More prunes, slightly bitter. Quite sweet. Excellent and unique.
Fat @Mikkeller Viktoriagade. Dimmig gyllengul öl med ett större vitt skum. Klassisk "belgisk" doft med lätt kryddig jäst, hö och citrus. Bra balanserad.
Yeasty aroma. Slightly sweet and bread-y to taste. Like a typical tripel if slightly sweeter.

330 ml bottle. Vintage July, 2011. Cloudy brown color topped by a small creamy beige head. Big yeasty sour malt nose. Notes of figs and Green apple. Tangy, syrupy, prune notes. Intense and acidic notes, think crusty bread, sour apple, unripe kiwi fruit and elderberries. Quite complex and flavorful.

Bottle at De Garre, Bruges. Pours hazy orange with a frothy, white head that leaves lacing and lasts throughout. The aroma contains apple, peach, hops, malt, yeast and sugar; fruity smell. It tastes medium fruity sweet and medium bitter. Fizzy carbonation, oily texture, long finish with some warming alcohol.

Clear, golden, some particles in it, high carbonation and gigantic head. Aroma is avesome: lots of oranges, apples. cane sugar, caramel, spices, overall belgian notes. Medium to high bitterness, medium to light body, low bitterness. Fruity flavour, orange, spices, some sweetness. Warming alcohol.

Tap (Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen). Clear, golden colour with small white-grey head. Aroma is delicate, fruity, malty a little bit spicy related to belgian hops. Medium dry, fruity, malty in the taste. Light in feeling, drinkable, cannot feel the power the beer.

Aroma: Sweet fruits with bubblegum and slight caramel. 
Flavour: Fairly sweet, fruity and brown sugar with caramel notes. Aftertaste is slightly bitter and fruity sweet. 
Colour: deep orange with a white head.

Aroma: low esters, citrus, strawberries, fruity light candy sugar, regular sugar, some pale malt, alcohol, low herbs.
pale, clear, white foam, ok retention. light sweetness, lightly bitter. light body, slick feel, lively, long finish that is low sweet, and gently warming. 
Overall pleasantly balanced, refreshing and lively.
Incredible beer. It have got it all. Lovely strong aroma and a lot of mindblowing taste

Best before 09/2017, aperta il 1° marzo 2017.
Dorata carica, lievemente opalescente, schiuma bianca di media persistenza.
Aroma di banana, chiodi di garofano, arancia, erbaceo fresco e pungente ma decisamente gradevole, il tutto accompagnato da note di pera.
Al palato attacca con un erbaceo fresco e balsamico che accompagna tutta la bevuta, intermezzo di banana e arancia che lascia il posto sul finale ad un tepore etilico molto presente (i 10 gradi si sentono tutti) e ad una nota di arancia candita e chiodi di garofano.
Retrolfatto di banana ed erbaceo fresco.
Molto carbonata, corpo sorprendentemente leggero.
Draught at resturant Treskillingen at the post museum Old town Stockholm. Big and lasting beige head. Very nice belgian yeast aroma. Very intence yeast taste. A litle hard bitterness that lingers.
Dark orange colour with small head.Fruity of orange peel and citrus nice oily texture and.fresh. fruity flavors well balanced and smooth overall.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper hazy, big beige head. Smell of ripe fruits, hints of berries, light malts, hint of caramel, spices and some herbs. Heavy sweet, alot of fruity malts, ripe fruits, apple peel, herbs, spices, alot of complex flavors. Extremely smooth texture. Medium bitter. World class tripel

Bottle. Bottled Aug 2009; Drank June 2011 - Orangey Gold in colour. Yeasty; lots of very fine floaties; nicely sedimented. Spicy; cloves and pepper. Malty; lots of pale malt; pale candy sugar. Fruity; citrus - oranges and mandarins, tropical fruits. Hoppy; grassy hops. Smooth. Predominately sweet fruity spicy yeasty with some hop bitterness. Surprised me; because of the name I expected a rather harsh and bitter beer, not a sweet one. Terrific. A lovely beer! (2011-06-10)

bottle @ home
hazy monk brown, cappuccino head with lacing
winey, candy. rum, light nut,, cream, raisin, vanilla
complex, toffee, butterscotch, cookie, nuts, honey, liquor

Bottle from Appellation Wines Dalry. Pours slightly hazy orange with beige head in wide Rochefort glass. Nose is orange peel, sweet candied sugar and caramel, fruits and light spices. Taste is sweet caramel, slight sugary, hoppy bitter, dried fruits. Solid performer.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2017 Color anaranjado, turbio, con capa de espuma de un blanco puro de cuatro dedos de grosor (apariencia jabonosa, compacta, y de muy buena retención; cuidado al verterla en la copa, es peligrosa). Carbonatación aparentemente normal visualmente (pero en boca se revela casi efervescente; para mi gusto algo excesivamente carbonatada pero nada molesto). Aroma muy completo: frutal (piña y naranja), floral y herbal, vainilla, un toque como de menta fresca. En boca, dulce de primeras, se vuelven a notar la piña y la naranja, pero en este caso hay que buscarlas más, con final amargo (debido al lúpulo) y seco (alcohol presente, pero casi imperceptible). Diría que tiene más de 30 IBUs, o, al menos, en una cerveza así se notan bastante más que en las típicas IPAs que dicen tener 60. Completa, compleja y única. De lo mejor en cuanto a Triples.

Aroma: Yeast and a little citrus
Appearance: Hazy yellow with full of white head.
Taste: sweet and complex of sugar and malts.

My favourite Tripel with nice dry taste after taste.
Bottle at home, BBE October 16. Not sure how old this is. Pours a light straw, big bubbly head. Aroma is grass, yeast, sweet, candy. Taste is sweet, complex, yeast, fresh grass. Nice

Bottle 2013 date, nice copper color with big white head, nice amount of carbonation, aroma is pleasant with substantial malt, honey essence, spices with clove and some faint nutmeg..mouthfeel is insanely smooth yet deep and complex, lacing on chalice is top notch, really enjoyable tripel that brings some alcohol legs on the finish, tasting great after 3 yrs..

Bottle. Hazy golden color with off-white head. Aroma has fruits, caramel, dried fruits, apricot and yeast. Taste is fruity with long bitter and sweet aftertaste. Flavors of fruits like apricot and citrus, malt, coriander and other spices. Very nice combination with excellent mouth feeling.

Bottle from the Bottle Shop in Bruges. Pours hazy golden with an off white head. Aroma of yeast and citrus. The taste has spice, orange and lemon citrus, yeasty bread and a nice bitter finish that lingers. Well hidden alcohol. Nice full mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Bottled, 330ml, aged 8yrs from my Anniversary collection given by Sandra and sourced by Fin, a Christmas Eve treat. Hazy gold to amber with short beige head. There is a huge Belgian yeast note right from the start, candied pear drop flavours, spicy with an earthy hopped character. There is a drying, bittering element along with a resinous note. Rich and boozy. Super beer.
Golden bit hazy with very rich white head. Fruity yeast aroma. Sweet sour fruity taste immediately followed by medium bitterness. Carbonated. Slight bitter aftertaste with some fruity notes.

Golden, a bit hazy, with a rocky very long lasting head. Aroma of pepper, clove, banana, peach, apple, grape. As the time goes on the bouquet expands with mature fruit. At last there are some honey and caramel from the malt and some floral hints of the hops which are somehow hidden by the aromas of the yeast. Its 10% ABV but not ethilic at all, it gives you just some reassuring warming and a sudden rush of happiness while you drink. Medium bodied, fizzy, medium sweetness. Not so much to say: one of the top five beers Id bring to a desert island. Gorgeous.

Bottle at home. 2015 vintage. An almost perfect triple. Full bodied. Sweet taste of fudge, herbs, hints of tar and liquorice, honey and warming alcohol. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Very balanced but yes, sweet.

Uber, Seattle. Creamy head, clear rich yellow gold. Creamy heavy tripel aroma, sweet with heavy malt. Smooth, lovely rich body. Cool smooth beer. Vanilla yeast, smooth alcohol flavor, light sweetness. Creamy finish. Nice.

Bottle at Incubate, gift from a friend. Pours a hazy amber with a thick white head. Aroma has strong Belgian yeast dominating, obvious Candy sugar adres, banana, peach, herbs, breasts malts. Taste is over medium sweet, light bitter. Medium body & carbonation.
Bottle. Orange. Belgian yeast aroma, banana, hops. Sweet fruity flavour, yeasty finish
Tap @ Fermentoren. Hazy, murky orange. Barley, apricot, cream, dusty yeast. Smooth herbs, red berries. Sour and bitter. Very smooth palate. Medium body and dry palate. A very nice tripel.
Fruitige neus. Smaak is vrij zoet, maar niet storend zoet. Gedroogd fruit, honing, lekkere gist.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Mega smak i aromat suszonych owoców z bananami na czele. Alkohol mógłby się ułożyć. Za rok-dwa będzie wyśmienite.

Pours a murky, opaque amber with a thick frothy, lasting head. Aroma is very complex - typical Belgian yeast, fruity/herbal esters, candy sugar, apricot, leaves. Taste is sweet apricot and candy sugar, bread, yeast and strong alcohol in the backbone. Heavy body, creamy texture, lively carbonation and a a dry finish. Just awesome.

Aroma - some alcohol, Brett yeast, coriander, candied sugar, clove, honey, herbs, and alcohol.
Appearance - the body is a hazy golden rod color, with some fine sediment, and fuller sediment. The head is white and 1/4" and fades into a foam.
Taste - has the classic Belgium yeast qualities, the taste has some spices - clove, coriander, there is a candied sugar, raisins, slight vanilla, honey, and herbs, there is also a slight bitterness.
Palate - medium body, slightly creamy texture, average carbonation, slightly sweet and bitter finish.

Bottle.
Appearance - golden, with a decent continental head.
Nose - honey and dried fruits. Some light spice such as white pepper and maybe cardamon.
Taste - mainly dried fruit soaked in honey.
Palate - rich and full bodied with a tangy texture and a fairly good finish.
Overall - good, but many other Abbey Tripels, have a better tang than this.
From bottle. Pours clear, pale amber. Nose of esters, mandarins, resin. Taste is spicy, funky, white pepper, rich fruit, tiny bit tart.
Yeastt and citrus, golden with a good white head, medium body, quite fizzy, quite bitter, alcohol is intense but elegant, taste is the same of the aroma...a good triple, obviously is a de dolle.

Kolor złoty z nieznacznym zmętnieniem. Piana na powierzchni piwa tworzy ogromną, białą czapę, zbudowaną z drobnych pęcherzyków. Jest bardzo trwała, jednak dość skąpo zdobi szkło.
Aromat raczej wytrawny, owocowy, gdzie dominują białe winogrona, dalej drożdże i nuty kojarzące się z białym winem, odrobina ziołowości.
W smaku jest bardzo podobnie, ponownie nuty winno owocowe, tutaj oprócz białych winogron w tle jest słodka pomarańcza z cytryną, lekkie akcenty ziołowe i ziemiste, piwo jest wytrawne. Goryczka ziołowa, sucha ale delikatna.
Alkohol idealnie ukryty w aromacie. W smaku pojawia się raczej w formie dość szlachetnej, przyjemnie rozgrzewa przełyk. Wysycenie wysokie, idealnie się tu sprawdsza.

UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 Hazy golden colour, two fingers head with bubbless of al sizes, good retention and lace. Aroma of cardamom, green apples, cinnamon, herbs, fruits. Full body, with good carbonation and thick palate, you can almost eat it. Taste of cardamom, apples, pepper, brandy fruits. Its kind like a polvorón. Another great one by the brothers.

Bottle from Cork & Cask. Hazy bronze body with tiny yeast flecks floating beneath a medium off-white head. Steady carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of apple, yeast, honey, banana and white pepper. Flavour of white sugar, grass, flowery hops and lemon sherbet. Medium body with a frothy mouthfeel. Soft fizz. A touch too sweet in my opinion but I really enjoyed it.
bottle 0,33. Pours golden hazy with large white head. Yeast, bread, malty sugars, fruits, banana. Alcohol is noticable. Full bodied an soft carbonation.

Pours a cloudy, hazy golden Amber with a thick straw white head. Hearty bready aroma with ripe fruit and a hint of spice. Somewhat boozy but great flavors of hearty malt character, complex yeast and a little clove in there.

33cl bottle at home. Semi-hazy golden pour with a tall white head with good retention. Visible carbonation rising to the top. Notes of honey, some dank saison funkness, floral hops, mineral components, malt sugars. Medium body with high carbonation and a bitter-sweet and refreshing finish.

Pullo @ Brugs Beertje, Brugge. Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena ja sameana, noin kahden sormen paksuisen pysyvän vaahdon suojaamana. Tuoksussa on viljaa, mausteista hiivaisuutta, kypsää makeaa hedelmää ja marjaisuuttakin. Maussa mausteinen ja hivenen yrttinen hiivaisuus jatkuu, kypsää hedelmää ja marjaakin on jälleen joukossa. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen ja hivenen makean puoleinen. Hiilihappoja on myös tuntuvasti ja alkoholisuuskin tuntuu, muttei maistu. Monimuotoinen ja täyteläinen tripel, malliesimerkki tyylistä ja niin tasapainoinen, ettei korjattavaa oikeastaan ole.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Pours hazy orange golden with lazing offwhite head. Aroma has light malt, biscuit, light bread, ripe fruity notes like apricot. Also spicy with warm orange and hints of coriander. Taste is complex and surprisingly sweet with a complex mix of light malt, biscuit, caramel, ripe fruit and spices with coriander and white pepper. Finish is warm, alcoholic, dry yet semi-sweet and spicy. A modern tripel.

Mousse peu persistante. Couleur cuivrée. Épices, foin, levure belge. Quelques notes de fruits mûrs, mais ça reste léger. Par contre on est vraiment sur la levure, le pain. Un peu damertume aussi. Puissante en alcool en arrière bouche. On est limite sur un goût de fromage de Maredsous. Bien dans lensemble.

330mL bottle from International Beer Collector. BB JUL 2017
Pours a big white foam dying into a dense cap atop a murky orange body.
Moderate intensity nose; plenty of yeast character - bread dough, stewed apple, ripe pear & apricot, white pepper, clove & nutmeg, toast, caramel, touch of booze.
Lively carbonation, creamy body, would be rather sweet & rich without the carbonation cutting through. Long persistence on the palate.
Lovely palate - ripe banana & toffee (Banoffee!?), bread crust & sweet dough, stacks of pepper & clove & cinnamon, sultana, boozy warmth, a long smooth earthy spicy finish with moderate bitterness.
Tremendous Belgian strong!

33cl bottle at home. Somewhat hazy orange with a medium white soapy head. Medium to full body. Quite sweet with subtle bitterness. Citrus, tangerine, herbs, malts, sugar and some coriander. OK tripel.

En botella de 11.2 oz desde Whole Foods Tribeca. Septiembre 2016. Tripel belga espumosa, blanca y deliciosa. 8/10

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.33 l bottle at "t Brugs Beertje". Slightly hazy, golden amber with a large, foamy, almost stable, white head. Sweetish, very yeasty-spicy aroma of cloves, banana, pear, vanilla and a bit of honey. Sweetish, very yeasty-spicy taste of banana, cloves, vanilla, honey and hints of peach, followed by a medium long, moderately bitter, very yeasty-spicy finish. Medium body, very effervescent mouthfeel, lively carbonation. Tasty, rather intense but well-balanced stuff, unfortunately too much carbonation.

After the success of Tripel Karmeliet, Im doing the unthinkable and rating a Tripel that isnt a part of the book. Aroma is clove, barnyard, yeast, banana, earthy hops, booze. Appearance is dark goldenrod, light tan head, super hazy. Taste is booze, clove, yeast, banana, tropical fruit, dry, really boozy. Mouthfeel is medium body, light and very crisp carbonation, boozy clove aftertaste. Overall, yikes this is hot. But I bet the booze hid the less palatable flavors normally associated with the style.

Roppantul telt kinézetű, szalmasárga színű belga tripel, az egyik legjobb a piacon: valószínűleg ez esetben hihetünk a pontok hitelességében, a következő fázisok legalábbis ennek ellenkezőjét nem indokolják. Kirobbanásig teli aromahalmaz a megszokott gabonás, frissítően savanykás, élesztősen fanyar jegyekkel, intenzív tripelbomba pezsgő hangulattal. Ízvilága hasonlóképpen gazdag, gabonaszirup a javából, melyben az édeskés jegyeket remekül egyenlítik ki a karakteresen kesernyés vonalak az utóízben. Hiperszuper abbey tripel.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Dulle Teve 10º (Mad Bitch) by Brouwerij De Dolle Brouwers at Konstruktorska Business CenterMegapiana. Przyprawowosc, jasne owoce bardzo roznorodne (brzoskwinie, banany, jablka), miod, puchate w ustach, lekkie alko, slodkawe, bdb+ Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

Robe blonde, mousse explosive, mais peu persistante. Nez puissant sur des notes de fruits mûrs, dagrumes, de foin sur un fond de houblon, de malt et de levures. Bouche à lattaque fruitée, de lampleur, un alcool marqué mais un bel équilibre grâce à lamertume du houblon et une pointe dacidité. Une triple tout en puissance. Une bière dhiver.

Robe orange cuivrée, trouble, bullage assez intense au versement. Beau col de mousse, persistant, blanc. Nez très puissant de malt, céréales. Epicé et chaud, révélant son taux dalcool. Attaque douce de malt caramel, de pain/pâtisserie (gourmand). Bouche qui se déploie sur plus damertume et une petite aigreur. Levure belge bien marquée pour une triple de caractère. Note fruitée de pommes sucrée (compote). Longueur douce-amer particulière.
Botella 33 cl en el Lupulo tomada en junio 2010. Sin lote ni fecha cpref. (r1428). Triple belga con sabores maltosos algo secos y buena sensación alcohólica Cuerpo medio a intenso de 10 vol. Buena.

Oranssin kuparinen olut todella rajusti vaahtoavalla vaahdolla. Alussa lasiin pystyi kaatamaan vain puolet pullosta ja tällöin olut näytti varsin kirkkaalta. Kun koko pullo on kaadettu lopulta lasiin, on olut selvästi sameahko. Vaahto häviää aika nopeasti lopulta ja jättää hennon valkoisen vaahtokerroksen sekä pienen tiskiainemaisen pitsin. Tuoksu voimakkaan hedelmäinen ja mausteinen. Myös maku hedelmäinen ja mausteinen varsinkin loppupuolella makua, mutta alkoholi puskee turhan paljon läpi. Maltaisuus myös läsnä jälkimaussa. Keskitäyteläinen suutuntuma.

Colore giallo paglierino, schiuma pannosa persistente, molto carbonata. Al naso sentori di arancia , albicocca e zucchero candito, in bocca ritorna lalbicocca, speziato, maltato e poco frumento. Sul finale pepato.
Keg @ Northern Monk Refrectory, Leeds. Dangerously good given it neither tastes nor smells anything like its strength. Has a mild hoppy fruitiness.

bottle @ Party Source / Bellevue KY --- Aroma of malt and caramel. Over-the-top white head that takes its time dropping, fluffy bands of lace. Taste is edgy yeasty caramel malt that grows and grows into medium carbonation, and, finally to mild hops that cant shut off the caramel. A big brew, even a little pushy, but so well balanced, and drinkable. I will find another.
Bottle, 330 ml from Pivoljub. Shared with JFK10000. Pours orange, huge white head. Sweet, fruity, citrus, spicy, bit yeasty. Sourish note. Dry. Very good. Lively carbonation. Alcohol well hidden.
11.2 oz bottle pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit and spicy. Taste is spicy yeast and fruit.
Golden with white head. Gusher. Alcohol aromas, yeast, fruit. Yeast, spices, caramel sweetness and some orange peel makes a nice tasting beer. Well balanced finish.

DWF; Bottle 33 CL., drunk at Cardinal. Pours huge, hazy gold with a lasting, laging off-white head. Nose is huge, malt, citrus, yeast, sugar and spice. Taste is moderat to heavy sweet and bitter, balanced with a lasting, bitter, sugar, spice and warming finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is lively.

Bottle, bottled July 2014. Appearance- golden with a slight amber tinge, an enormous pillowy white head which gradually settles. Turns murky brown when you pour it all out. Lots of bubbles rising. Aroma- Belgian yeast, bready malt, stewed apple, dark fruit, spices, orange peel, baked fruits, caramel biscuit undertones. Taste- lots of fruit here- apple pie, stewed fruit, brown sugar, caramel, rhubarb, spices, orange peel, solid malt presence, pretty boozy, fruitcake. Nice and full-bodied, doesnt hide its strength. Impressive.

Aroma: orange, apricot, spicy, some malty notes
Taste: medium sweet, peach, apricot, malty, honey, alcohol, orange, spicy

Alcohol is wel aanwezig door de verzoete smaak van honing, kruiden en zelfs wat peper, weinig bitter, ook in de nasmaak die wat droog en zurig aandoet. Aroma is zwaar, bijna muf zoet. Smaak is het meest complex, aroma iets minder. Kraag is een kraag, hoog- en langstaand. Ceeoootwee is rijkelijk, teveel eigenlijk.

Cloudy yellow color, huge white heaf. Aroma of malt, Belgian yeast, spices, citrus, honey. Taste is similar, malty and sweet, spicy, yeasty with honey and citrus, some alcohol notes. Full body, average carbonation. Good stuff.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle 0,33 from Pivoljub beer shop in Ljubljana. Hazy pale yellow liquid with gigantic head. Smell of coriander, candy, banana, soap, flowers. Full body, light carbonation. Fruity taste, coriander, some alcohol in it, grains, flowers.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Tripel is one of my favorite styles. La Fin Du Monde, and Merry Monks are my two benchmarks of the style. Dulle Teve is a bit stronger, has a bit more "burn".... but the finish is just not smooth. I like to get a deep smell of the beer from the tulip, and after a sip, when I breathe out, I expect wonderful complex tastes. Unfortunately, the finish on this one just has some funk in there that doesnt work for me.

Pours quite dark for a tripel (medium copper) and clear with a moderate off-white head and good lacing. Extremely heavy sediment. Nose is extremely boozy (almost like a barley wine) with some notes of syrup, hops, and coriander. Flavor is a bit more mellow but still very hot with a bit of sweetness up front but a very dry yet yeasty finish. This one may have aged a little too much because this really doesnt look, smell, or taste like a tripel, though its still generally good, if a little alcoholic.

Pours murky amber with a massive frothy head. Aroma is of spice, faint candy, very weak aroma. Tastes of bubblegum, banana, cloves, and a grapey sweet finish. Has a light body with high carbonation and a tingly, warming finish. I felt as though something tasted off about this beer, maybe my bottle. Almost tasted a little infected.

Bottle. Hazy golden with a huge frothy white head. The nose is fruity and yeasty. Banana, cloves, strawberry, light hay, dry grass. Flavour has hay, honey, banana, strawberries, dry grass, wood, alcohol. Full body, oily texture, lively carbonation. Heavy sweet and medium bitter with warming and light hot alcohol. A bit hefty on alcohol and sweetness.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours clear dark amber with a finger of off-white head. Carb is visible. Big fruity aromas of apple pie/crumble, plum, and citrus. Also picking up notes of mint, banana and bubblegum (like in some German hefeweizens), general cake and honey malt, and even something slightly herbal or medicinal; interesting stuff thus far! Dark/muscovado sugar and treacle/molasses are the biggest notes in the taste, though theres also a noticeable sour edge here, with citrus and sour apple notes emerging. Dark fruits are prominent too. Rather full bodied, thick, and oily, and with some carbonation sticking around. Quite interesting and imaginative take on the traditional abbey style overall.

Bottle. Hay orange body with a small white head. Aroma of spicy yeast, honey, banana, citrus fruits. Taste is sweet, toffee, mild alcohol, with fruity hops, peppers, mild acidic, spicy finish with mild alcohol. A robust and nice tripel.

Pours with an insane top. Very aggressive, white, to slightly off white. Beer is murky brown, a lot of carbonation. Aroma of malts and some fruit notes, slight sour hint of notes. Taste is exceptionally full. Sweet at first, then slightly sour, tasting buds have a lot of work here. After the first impression, strong full aftertaste, some caramel feeling. Aftertaste is slightly acidic, but pleasant, and the warmth of the alcohol % can be felt in your tummy. An extraordinary beer!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 Bottiglia 2014 ben invecchiata. Colore arancio, bella schiuma bianca compatta. Bel aroma di malto, lievito, floreale. Spettacolo al palato, caramello, spezie, corpo pieno e intenso, bel l?alcol accompagna alla grande, perfetta carbonazione. Grande tripel.

Color dorato carico con un abbondante cappello di schiuma bianca molto persistente. Al naso il warming etilico la fa da padrone nascondendo quasi le note speziate e floreali. Ottima la presenza di sentori di cereale. Corpo ben strutturato con carbonzione medio alta come da stile. Al palato ancora alcol e sentori floreli e speziari. Leggerissime note di miele. Chiusura con eleganti note erbacee.

Sweet malty and fruity, some yeast, notes of caramel, fudge, some dried fruit notes, sultana, light splattering of spices, lovely.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beergium. Hazy yellow color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, earthy notes, yeast, toffee, grass and ripe fruits. Bitter finish with citrus, earthy notes, ripe fruits, yeast and toffee. Excellent tripel.

Draft at Maxs. A pale and hazy yellow with a soft white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast and funk, melon, banana, and spices. Flavors of banana, hay, clove, a little lemon. Body is medium, mouthfeel is full and sticky. Really terrific. Alcohol is present but very well hidden at this ABV.

Yet another Belgian beer that had slipped past my radar: finally caught up with it in De Bierboom, Brugge on Sunday 7th Feb 2016. Dark amber body, slight haze: beige head that wanted to hang around. Nice blend of aromas and flavours, semi-sweet malty molasses with a bittering hop presence linked by a yeasty bonding that brings out fruit esters from the hops and draws out mild caramel hints from the malts. Far to easy to drink, I almost had another bottle but it was only 12:00 (noon) and I was on a tasting mission.
Unique tripel , this a powerful beer , lots of aroma & taste ,floral fruity sweet notes , amazing

Dark brown colour. White medium head. Dark fruits, caramel, raisins in the aroma. Berries, coffee at first. Caramel and plums in the middle. Brown sugar in the aftertaste. Nicely balanced, very enjoyable beer. However, would like to have a one tasting more to analyze the palate. Beer was served bit colder than I expected.
Flaska från SB. Dimmigt orangefärgad med vitt skum. Fruktig doft av belgisk jäst. Kryddig smak med värmande alkohol.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange with a generous lasting foamy off white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel, banana, bubblegum, clove. Taste is of bread, caramel, brown sugar, citrus, grassy, banana, spice, apple. Dense, foamy to oily mouthfeel, medium to heavy carbonation.

33cl (bb..) at Biere mit Stil 1: Worldwide Tripel [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Freiburg JAN2016 - Dry and earthy rendition of the style, offering some yeast-powered novelties to the by-now familiar bouquet: lemon cake and orange drops, pear tarte pierced by a friendly helping of schnaps - before then becoming quite literal if refreshing in flavour: grains, vanilla, good hop bitters. Almost quintessentially Belgian (West-Flemish) in its secure reliance on sugars to boost fruity esters and attentuation - and at 10% oddly less alcoholic than I have their beers in mind.

Bottle. Pours a clear golden colour with a huuuuge white head. Well, clear-ish - theres a lot of yeast floating arond in it. Aroma of malt, yeast and sugar. Taste is of malt, yeast, lots of hops, citrus, spices and alcohol. Above medium body and carbonation off the scale. Bitter and dry finish. Very good.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Golden orange with HUGE, frothy, white head. Fresh aroma of strawberry bubblegum, apple, citrus and green grapes. Fruity, bready and quite sugary taste with light hop freshness. Clean, crisp and really enjoyable. Light, peppery finish.
One of the best tripels I ever had. The complex fruity aroma contains peach, apricot, apple, pear, grapes. Wish I could enjoy this beer in Korea.

Lite grumlig, gyllene gul-orange, mycket stort och nära vitt skum. Doft: Godis, gran, röda äpplen, humle, persika, belgo, alkohol. Smak: Belgo/duvel aktigt, barr, äpplen, honung, fruktgodis, burk persika, alkohol, tvål, malt.

Bottled 330ml. -Courtesy of kajser27, shared with him, Marko and franski. Dark golden coloured, huge white head, spices and alcohol in the nose. Sweet malty, spicy, fruity, evident alcohol presence and dry finish. Also mild spices and fruits in the finish. Pleasant one but nothing more than that.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2016 
Aroma:

Belgian yeast, fruit, malts, caramel, vinous, sour and spices.

Appearance:

Golden/amber beer with slight yeast and with a huge white/off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Medium/heavy sweet with Belgian yeast, fruit, malt, caramel and spices.
Large white head, golden orange coloured body, way to much carbonation, fruity melon peach yeast smell, high carbonation fruity yeasts some sweet and warming malts, melon like taste

Cloudy, amber-orange colored, strong white frothy head, some overfoaming, some floaters, good lacing. Aroma candy sugary, fruits, yeast, some alcohol and strong spicy phenols. Taste is medium sweet malt, brewing sugar, fruity, yeast, strong spicy phenolic, bit of spice, some alcohol, medium bitterness, dry finish. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, bit creamy.

F: huge, white, extremely long lasting.
C: hazy, murky orange, gold with floating yeast particles.
A: some vinous tones, grape-fruit peels, orange, candy sugar, spicy, fruity yeast.
T: 0,33l bottle from Beer Temple in Bruxelles, BB 08/16, full-bodied, complex, very lively carbonated, dried fruit, woody, raisin, candy sugar, cognac alcohol, banana, passion fruitiness, oily texture, floral hops, coriander, cloves, honey, peach, dry finish on the palate, great beer for this style, worth to try.
330ml bottle. Hazy yellow/amber body with a huge compact white head. Fruity and sugary, with flavors of alcohol, solvent and yeast. Dry finish.

Flaska från SB, nyårsfirande med kusin Mattias. Ljus disig med rejält högt, vitt skum. Toner av citrus, persika, grönt äpple, vindruva. Något syrlig med belgojäst och morotsjuice. Smaken är kryddig, lätt brödig med viss bitterhet och ett humlebett i avslutningen som lämnar kvar en del koriander och skumbanan. Väl kolsyrad, bubblig och något sträv kropp. Sticker lite väl i munnen. I övrigt en kraftfull trippel.

Thanks kajser! Misty golden body with a huge, enormous lasting white head. Enormous spicy malty aroma, some alcohol, orange - nice fresh notes. Taste... soft, vaguely citric candy, yet dry, not particularly sweet, not sour, though more on the sweet side, slightly. Strangely dry. The alcohol is very obvious, too obvious. Yeasty kinda. Ooof. I have to admit, I love tripels, and I really didnt like this one. in fact, one of the worst Ive head.

Bottle. Nose is amazing, floral funk, hints of soft summer fruits, lots of white grape, almonds, marzipan. Taste is cream, almonds, sharp grape, citrus, summer fruits, ripe pears, herbal hops, honey, hints of medicinal hops,banana, apricots, slight spice. The finish is pleasingly dry. A touch too carbonated for me.

A spectacular beer.

Bottle
Aroma-floral, fruits
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

330ml bottle from Systembolaget. Almost clear pale straw-golden. Much foam in the glass, requires several pours in the glass. Fruity aroma with yeast and ripe pears. Silky smooth and rounded mouthfeel, medium carbonated. Fruity, vinous and warming taste, pear, yeast, white pepper, white wine, herbs and sweet honey. Several pleasant long flavors.
Bottle split three ways. Oily pale golden pour with a huge head. Notes of grains, caramel, pear juice, lemon rind and some sweet apples.
Nice yellow colour, well carbonated. Nice aroma. A little candis sugar in the end. I only got two from today's special release. Will buy more for storage!

Tasted this beer for the first time at "En Öl & Whiskeymässa i Göteborg 2014" and I fell in love in it. 
To bad I didnt remember this when it was released at Systembolaget, Sweden in November 2015. I only bought two bottles... 

Anyway, there are so many great beers out there and so little time... Here is my review: 

The liquid is orange, hazy and the beer pours with a huge, four finger high, white, fluffy head. After several minutes the head shrink to a one finger "whipped cream" type of head and leaves a lot of lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Belgian yeast, orange, citrus, honey, banana, peach, caramel, bread, spices and floral hops. 
Taste: Caramel malt, pine, yeast, banana, orange, Belgian spice, apricot and honey. 
Mouth: Full body with a round, sweet mouthfeel. Complex texture. Medium to high carbonation. Spicy, boozy, sweet - Just right!

Flaska systembolaget. Orange relativt dimmig vätska med stort fluffigt smutsvitt skum. Fuktig doft med blött hö, lite äpple och belgojäst. Kryddig ganska söt smak. Mogna äpplen, koriander och säd. Spritsig munkänsla med mycket kolsyra. Värmande alkohol. Välgjord

Draft at uber. Apparently Ive had this and ticked it a "3" at some point. Lets see what a different mood does for this. Cloudy pale pour with small ring of bubbles for head. Aroma is ... weird. First thing I think is dishwater, followed by overripe fruit, followed by vegetables. Fuck man, I dont know, but basically nothing in this nose appeals to me. Taste sweet up front, herbal fruity bitterness at end but feels too thick, too sweet, too strong, too gross throughout. Overall: nope, I do not care for this. Id like to see through the apparent weaknesses of my own palate, but I cant -- I enjoy no phase of this beer. Im clearly in the minority.

Hazy orange pour with large tight white head that lasts a long time. Smells of tart green apples, apricots, some clove, some floral hop and lightly earthy yeast notes. The taste has a bit of hop and acid bite at the front end, then floral honey, apricot, light apple, fresh multigrain bread, musty yeast. Very good balance of sweetness and bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Exceptionally crafted tripel - many are overly sweet but this one has excellent complexity and balance.

Fruity, esthery, spicy, ripe prunes, alcohol, lots of yeast and floral hops.
Hazy golden colour, medium white head.
Noticably sweet, lightly bitter, lots of esthery notes, ABV evident, but well integrated, 
Fullbodied, lively carbonation, sweetish finish.

Hazy orange color with big white head. Aroma is apples, citrusy, apricots, toffee, candied sugar, very yeasty. Taste is with tart fruits (hints of balsamico even!), quite a sting at the beginning, again toffee and spices, with a boozy, warming finish. High carbonation. A quite complex Tripel, driven very much by fruit esters and sweetness, the tart sting at the beginning is really adding a lot of character. One of the better Tripels Ive had.

Hazy golden color, huge white head. Aroma of malt, ripe sweet and sour fruits, grass, hops and spices. Sweet taste with light bitterness in finish and spicy aftertaste. Medium body and lively carbonation. Good tripel.

Pours murky light orange, explosive head no matter how careful the pour. Banana, honey, booze on the nose. Taste abounds in yeast and miscellaneous esters, banana, apricot, grass, pepper, clove. Very assetive tripel, quite good.

330 ml. bottle. Labeled April 2017 on cap. It pours a lightly hazed orange color with a massive, frothy off white head. The aroma is bready with some rather strong apple and pear esters. Dusty yeast. The flavor is strongly alcoholic with honey, orange and apple. Some hints of peppery yeast notes in the finish with more alcohol. Full bodied but well attenuated. Fruit, honey and alcohol stand out. Pretty good, although not really my favorite style.

Bottle at home. Aroma of ripe fruits, yeast, apples, malt, bread, toffee, caramel, some sugar, clove, more spicy notes, some hops. Flavour is medium sweet with a light bitterness in the finish. Body is medium, carbonation is quite lively. Nicely complex Tripel!
Bottle from Voldby. Pours orange with a good white head. Aroma and taste is malts, fruits, brown sugar, spices, caramel notes. Medium to full body. High carbonation. Nice bitter finish. Quite good.

Bottle at home. Huge gusher - murky orange pour with a big pillowy white head and good lacing. Big spicy yeasty, zesty, bready, peppery, herby, somewhat grassy, and tangy aroma. Taste is tangy, herbal, straw, black pepper, clove, yeasty, and doughy with a big spicy finish. Neodymium
body with high carbonation. Pretty good, but a bit aggressive.

0.33l bottle. Hazy orange body, with a huge white head. Huge banana and pear notes in the aroma with some lemon zest, bread and some dark sugar. Taste of bread, banana, peach, caramel and pepper. Medium body and carbonation, warming alcohol. Awesome beer.

Wonderful beer that always surprises, evolving terribly complex when a fantastic experience that I am glad I dedicate myself to prove it to a party. One of my favorite beers. De Dolle is one of my favorite brewery with very good products.

Tap @Proletariat. Aroma is lovely banana, some white pepper. Golden, clear, small white head. Medium/heavy sweetness, taste is apricot, banana, ripe fruit. Medium body, long aftertaste, nice little dryness. Orgasmic beer.

ASPETTO: biondo bellissimo, schiuma bianca, abbondante, fine e persistente. AROMA: decisamente speziato e fruttato. Un tocco di floreale. Intenso e invitante. GUSTO: dolce, calda, saporita. Sentori prevalentemente fruttati e di frutta sciroppata. Intenso. Corpo strutturato, carbonizzazione medio bassa. CONCLUSIONE: in assoluto una delle migliori Tripel che abbia mai assaggiato. Veramente un capolavoro!

2015/10/02 - Pours a cloudy, dark honey colour with a massive, soapy, off white head with great retention that leaves ample lacing. Aroma is bread, yeast, spices, white wine, banana, peach and pineapple. Taste is honey, spices, yeast, vinous notes, peach and light pineapple. Slightly metallic. Mouthfeel is medium with slightly sharp carbonation and a moderately boozy, warming finish. Mildly metallic, but overall, a solid triple that is unique and delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Piana obfita, sycząca, sporo grubych oczek, szybko opada do pierzynki. Barwa ciemno złota, wewnątrz trunku cała masa drobinek drożdżowych. Aromat przyjemnie słodkawy - są białe owoce - winogrona, porzeczki, liczi, są także kwiaty, likier brzoskwiniowy oraz dzikie nuty starej skóry, siana. W smaku bardzo podobnie, fajna owocowo-kwiatowo-likierowa słodycz, intrygująca szorstka cierpkość głogu, słodkie jasne wino gronowe. Goryczka nieduża, pikantno-ziołowa, nagazowanie wysokie, szampańskie. Alkohol, poza rozgrzewaniem w gardle, dość zgrabnie ukryty. 
Klasyczny Tripel, deserowy (może nieco za słodki w afterteasie), mocny i smaczny, choć zdradliwy (szybko możemy odczuć te 10%).

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 Mooi goudgeel licht troebel bier. Aroma en smaak van banaan, perzik, hooi, gerst, brood, nectarine en andere steenvruchten. Fluweelzachte schuimkraag die heel lang blijft. Weinig carbonatie. Heerlijke vol & romig zelfs licht mousserend in de mond. Lekkere fruitige warme afdronk die lang blijft hangen. Één van de betere tripels die er te vinden zijn.

Denne Dulle Teve bærer præg af en dejlig frugtig smag med et strejf af citrus. Dette er kombineret med en flot lys farve og en god karbonering der giver en god frisk fornemmelse. Et lille minus er lidt uklarhed i den lyse farve grundet små gærflager. Alt i alt en rigtig god oplevelse.
Aromas of fruits and citrus. Pale cloudy liquid, white head. Heavy sweetness and medium bitterness. Creamy texture, average carbonation. Very good and tasty triple!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Ljusgul grumlad vätska med maffigt och tjockt skum. Blommig, örtig doft. Bra balans mellan sötma och beska.

Pours a darker copper color. That might have been affected by the age of it. Nice head and carbonation. Had a fairly brandy taste. Some nice hopes to make it more like beer too. Over all a nice beer. I had this from a bottle.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 14.09.15. Muddy greyish yellow. Huge, dense, persistent and foamy off-white head. Fine aroma, with lemon, cloves, coriander, lemon grass and a hint of yellow apples. Quite carbonated. And rather good!
Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy golden with dense white head. Aroma of bananas, white bread, yeast, alcohol. Tastes sweet; highly carbonated.

hazy golden to orange colour, extremely huge, still dense white head, which lasts for several minutes; aroma of honey, overripe fruits, floral and earthy notes, some caramel and alcohol; bittersweet taste with spicy notes; excellent!

DATE TASTED: September 6, 2015 ... GLASSWARE: Chimay chalice... OCCASION: watching Naked and Afraid XLs Reunion Special... APPEARANCE: first, out of the bottle: frothing and bubbling like champagne! once out, thick, two-finger white head that retains like a beast...then, the body: thick, opaque and dark orange, with minimal effervescence but dark, chunky sediment at the glasss base.,, how does a 10% ABV retain such head? picture perfect ... AROMA: strong pineapple, apple and sugary candy; other hops suggest the slightest resin and pepper; yeasts hint at bubblegum... PALATE: demands a sipping approach, as the instant the DT hits the lips with thickness and froth... warming, active--a heater in the throat, while glistening on the teeth on the way down... TASTE: full-bodied, intense and punishing with its grapefruit, raisin, plum and pineapple... the malts come across as light biscuit... the yeasts, again, develop a bubblegum and peppercorn combination--what a complete bottle...OVERALL: A rare catch at Mountain Valleys bottom shelf and an awesome reconnect with a bottle hand-selected by Russells (Bloomsburg, PA) owner himself about a decade ago... one of the best Belgians I have encountered, claiming an experience in itself... big and bold but just warm enough to miss perfection--but not by much!

medium body, lively, long finish, hazy, frothy, white foam, lightly sour, spruce, 
Overall very good, lively Belgium style beer with a long lasting hoppy finish.
Dunkel amber farve med kremet skum. Lukt av sitrus, frukt og banan. Smak av sitrus, frukt, banan og malt. Fruktig og vinøs. Melkebaren.

Blonde légèrement orangée, trouble avec un peu de dépôt, mousse blanche énorme, qui tient un peu et laisse une légère dentelle sur le verre. Nez complexe sur la levure et les fruits : mirabelle, banane, abricot, un peu de malt aussi et dépices, lalcool est présent. Lattaque en bouche est assez brutale sur lalcool et les esthers, mais il se fond doucement dans les notes de fruits confits et de levures, superbe. Une excellente bière de dégustation, très complexe.

Bottle. Pours golden, clear with very big head (slightly overcarbed, low gushing). In aroma peaches, spices. In taste fruity peachy, spicy. Medium body, low bitterness. Alcohol present, not harsh. Very nice tripel.
Recht klassisches belgian triple mit einer feinen Würze, ordentlich Hefe, guter Perlung und einem leicht getreidigen Abgang, Einfach zu trinken, durchaus mit Charakter, ordentlich ohne zu glänzen.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2015 Pours wheat like brown opaque colour with stable foamy white head. Visualy medium carbonation. Aroma without note of an alcohol, with hints of wheat, grape (muscat), citrus, apple and wine vinegar.
flavor: smooth, sweet taste with notes of wheat, bread and fruity esters (grape, apple, plums, citrus) and dry / sweet finish (notes of candy sugar).
Malt sweetnees is high, hop bitterness is mild - medium, body is mouth-coating.
Alcohol is very well hidden.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden with a large, white head. Aroma is stone fruit, banana, peach, apricot, some vinous tones. Taste is along the same lines. Winegum, vinous flavors are strong. Really nice.

Bottle from Rudat in Dortmund. The beer has got a deep cloudy golden colour with a smooth body and steady head. Aroma of flowers, Belgian yeast and bread. Taste of light metallic Belgian yeast, old fruits, straw, dust, malt and grains. Little bit strange finish. Drinkable, yet nothing Id enjoy a second time.

Bottle. Pours a burnt hazy orange colour with a huge persisting frothy head. Smells of citrus, cooked surgar and booze. Taste is similar; oranges, candied citrus, along with a warm almost to boozy aspect and a nice lingering biterness. Mouthfeel is excellent; really smooth and onctuous.

Bottle. My first from this brewery. Slightly hazy brown appearance. Sweet and slightly fruity. Strong presence of alcohol and a lingering sweet aftertaste. An excellent tripel and one that should be seriously respected.
Pours a milky amber body with a medium and lasting head. Strong yeast aroma with tones of malt. Nice rich taste but the alcohol breaks through a bit too much.

Lukt: Malt, høy og gjær.
Utseende: Dunkel gulbrun farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Mye karbonering, dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Fruktig og sprudlende.
Hvor: Kjø[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Sandnes.
