Nez: Malté, abricot, fruits secs, levure
Bouche: Maltée, caramel, abricot, épicée, miel, fruits secs
Belle complexité. Une excellente triple fruitée avec un alcool présent mais discret.

Aroma: light fruits, good white wine, white and black peppers, some wild season-like notes.
Taste: very light sweeteness, light sourness.
Flavour: white grape, mature white wine, spices (black pepper, pimento).
Light spicy alcohol bitteness in the aftertaste.

Very good.

Blonde foncée trouble, belle mousse blanche très abondante. Carbonation importante avec beaucoup de matière en suspension, nez levuré de pêche, abricot et mirabelle, bière ronde très dense en bouche avec des notes (encore) dabricot et de pêche, léger côté "alcool de mirabelle". Grosse longueur en bouche avec une finale légèrement houblonnée & mielleuse. Délicieuse. Bière atypique, 100% artisanale à boire doucement, une vraie triple belge comme il en existe peu.

Bottle from Dranken Verheyen in Poppel. Blond/light amber to golden, rather clouded/hazy beer, with a nice and sticky foam. The beer is nicely carbonated with a strong aroma with fruity hints, with tropical and dark fruits, citrus, green apples and plums. In the background some hidden alcohol and spices are noticable. The taste is refreshing, crisp and smooth and has a slightly bitter taste, with some well hidden alcohol and a nice bouquet of fruits, really nicely balanced. Then the aftertaste leaves a sour, yeast-like impression, which becomes a hoppy, dry bitter finish.
Wow, different from for example Karmeliet or Westmalle but Im impressed.
Zware tripel. Licht geel van smaak. Dun maar erg veel smaak. Ruikt zoet-bitter.

Bottle. Pours in hazy amber body with medium stable creamy head. Aroma has light alcohol upfront with gentle peach fruity maltiness, floral, light banana and yeast. Taste has upfront white wine alcohol with fruity after taste, light woody with mostly banana, peach, some passion fruit. Alcoholy but in a really good balance. Body is medium, little bit oily, warming alcohol in the after taste, medium carbonation. I find alcohol in most of the "fresh" beers disturbing, but I must admit an very nice balance here.
Pours a hazy dark golden. Lots of white head. Aromas of bread, banana, Belgian yeast. Nice hoppiness to it.. A bit of a boozy bite. good.

In bottiglia. Colore dorato con velature arancio, torbida, con molta schiuma fine e persistente. Aroma di cereale, frutta gialla, lievito, crosta di pane, leggero erbaceo. Al palato corpo rotondo, pastoso con polpa di frutta gialla, crosta di pane, orzo, lievito, pepato, amaro erbaceo e leggermente terroso. Molto complessa ed intensa ma quantomai appagante.

Bottle shared. Pours almost clear golden with a big white head. Aroma of cloves, yeast, caramel, coriander, sweet malt and fruits. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.

Colore dorato carico, leggermente velata ed opalescente, schiuma abbondante, cremosa e persistente. Aroma pungente di luppolo e abboccato di malto, complesso. Corpo strutturato, ma non pesante, sorprendentemente duttile per lalta gradazione alcolica della birra. Comincia pastoso di malto e abboccato di caramello, poi si evolve con note tanniche e di frutta matura astringente (susine?) che ripulisce alla perfezione il palato. Finisce lunga, dolce e piacevolmente complessa.
Mooie kleur, beetje troebel. Een goede tripel met een fruitig aroma en een licht bittere smaak.
From XXXII. In Duvel glass. Playing KB Dark Side. Another exquisite beverage from the dolle. Its high ABV isnt noticeable in aroma nor taste
330ml bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Yeasty spicy and citrusy fruity aroma. Sweet and bitter taste like the aroma. Medium oily body with average to lively carbonation

330 ml bottled 14 months ago, poured into a small snifter and purchased at Mile High Wine & Spirits. Hazy dark orange appearance with a fluffy, lasting white head. Aroma of candy sugar, floral hops, caramel, coriander, clove, toffee, and touches of popcorn and butterscotch. Similar flavor, moderately sweet with some fruity esters and a light hop bitterness. Medium to full body with a lush, soft feel and mild carbonation. A great rendition of the style. Pairing: Phish - Funky Bitch, from 1997-11-30

330 mml bottle tasted on the 04/06/2015. Hazy golden to orange colour with a huge white head, thick and with very good retention. Aroma of yeast and intense malts. Taste is intense, with spices, yeast, malts and fruits. Notable presence of alcohol but balanced. Next one please!
Color caramelo, turbia. Mucha espuma duradera. Aroma dulce, a miel y especias. Muy carbonica, compleja: naranja, miel, pan, especias. Muy equilibrada. Grande.

330 ml bottle
Slightly hazy golden orange beer with big white head. Aroma has sweet honey, apricot, anise, appleish Belgian yeast and herbal hops. Flavor is sweet, fruity and herbal. Palate is full and foamy with some bitterness. Finish has medium bitterness. Aftertaste is toffeey and honeyish sweet with cheesecakeish sourness, herbal and yeasty with some pepper and anise. Nice tripel with very honeyish sweetness but also crisp herbal bitterness. No alcohol. Pouring the sediment makes the beer darker and murkier, tames the aroma, adds yeast taste and tames the sweetness a bit.
Amber kleurig bier met een witte droge schuimkraag. Smaak zoet van perzik en rozenbottel. Geur niet te zeggen te verkouden.

wow triple, so gentle and sweet in aroma with some tiny hops touch in background. Pours with thick, white, huge top. Taste is extra sweet with well enough hops complement to me but in a very shy manner, sweet aftertaste without sour notes. Thick bodied. Liked.

(De Dolle Dulle Teve 10º (Mad Bitch)) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a tulip, ABV 10%
Orange coloured body, very hazy, even a bit murky one could say. Huge white head, thick and with very good retention. Light lacing left around the glass.
Aroma is very fruity and inviting, apricots, light peach, yeast, not much different than any other triple but it has a little extra something.
Nice taste, malty and fruity, again apricot and peaches, light yeast, some wood, bubblegum, the alcohol kind of notable and if not tastewise, you start to feel it after a sip or two.
Medium thin body, carbonation is a bit high but not annoyingly so.
Very good, dangerously drinkable.

Huge pure white head on top of full slightly hazy yellow body. Intoxicating nose of restrained tropical fruit, spice and honey which is well reflected on the palate. Well integrated seemless carbonation. Powerful, pure and luxuriously delicious.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Aroma is earthy, tangy, peppery, yeasty. Taste is earthy, yeasty, some tang, grassy. Bitter finish.
Bottle to a tulip. Hazy golden color and fine white head with good retention. Nice aroma of apple and pear. Some lovely spice and cider notes... An excellent Tripel!
Bottle. Hazy copper color with a medium sized foamy white head. Aroma of yeast and wheat. Sour and bitter taste. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottle at home, one year old. Murky light brown with barely any head, just some big bubbles. Lots of cane sugar and pears. Spices, licorice, cinnamon buns, banabread, ice tea, bitter herbs, wort, long cooked English hops, and lime peel. Quite sweet, but with a medium bitter finish that balances it nicely. Medium to full bodied. Very strange beer, big. bold and somehow it seems like its not fully fermented.
Fantastic head, cloudy Golden. Light nose - closed - suger. Full body and some length. Taste is sugary and very pleasant.
Yellow with a very foamy head, pour gently. Yeast, banana, some sugar, tannins, honey, lemon peel. Sparkling dry. Full body and long dry sweet sizzling finish

Pours golden with off-white head - very good retention. Aroma is yeasty fruitness - some pear, apple (but nice, not green-apple of flavour), some tropical fruits as well. No phenolic note, spices are low. This aroma is excelent. Taste is dry but not watery, fruitness, some light caramel sweetness. This is world class tripel.

Cerveza con un aroma muy profundo, como a huerta y a campo, pero luego no es nada floral, tiene como un toque ahumado y un poco a miel y sobre todo frutas. Dejarla reposar un rato y gana mucho. Repetiría sin problemas.

33 cl bottle from Drink dAnnevoie, BE. Cloudy orange color with a crispy collapsing white head. Aroma: yeasty, fruity and and spiced. Well balanced Flavor: moderate sweet with a light bitter finish and light warming. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. A very nice triple!

Bottle. Murky honey poor, large foam head, almost like an unfiltered saison. Typical Dolle aroma of sugar/kandij, mixed with a lovely sour blend of apricots, cloves, nutmeg, anise, yeast/cheese. Yeast deposit reveals pear. Great stuff. Taste is anise, overwhelmingly. Also pear, a hint of mint, licorice...is this still a triple? Very hearty, very robust, doughy, quite a heavy taste (and maybe a little boozy even). Slightly sticky aftertaste. One is enough.
Tap. Opaque gold. Small head. Scattered lace. Faint nose of mild fruit, Belgian yeast. Very bubblegummy. Banana, apricot, candi sugar. Quintessential tripel. Very well camouflaged ABV.
This is quite a unique beer. In a lot of ways it tastes like a rather yeasty and alcoholic Tripel but there is this strong (after)taste of dough and pepper which gives this beer a unique identity.

Clear brilliant gold with a thin white head. Nice blonde Belgian malt sweetness with a wee ester note and gentle barnyard tones--a touch doughy and peppery. Lovely flavor of peppery yeast esters, sweet barnyard Belgian blonde malts, a touch of fruitiness, and a wee touch of fresh cut grass with a little kiss of booze warmth. Really swell.

Bottle. The cap opens with a small pop but luckily no gushing follows. Pours a golden body with some floating sediment, massive creamy head. Big malty aroma with all kinds of fruity esters and solid hoppiness. Taste has smooth maltiness mixing with a tenderly tart fruitiness and nice hop bitterness. Finish reveals the added sugar that helps to balance the alcohol. One of the best Abbey Tripels. After having a run of mediocre Tripels I am once again reminded why I love this style. I dont know why this beer is called the way it is. Its very smooth and coherent - probably the opposite of an actual mad bitch.

Degustata in bottiglia da 33 centilitri anche se letichetta errata dice 750 centilitri! :) ottima birra beverina nonostante lalta gradazione. Bel biondo leggermente torbido con cappello di schiuma. Sentori floreali e ciliegie sciroppate, al palato nocciola e caramello. Da perdere la testa.
Fantastic beer. Not your usual tripel. Aroma very typical for similar belgian beers but the taste is something unique. If you are into belgian tripels, this will surely be a positive experience

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2015 Dulle Teve uitgeschonken in Oerbier glas. Donkergele oranjeachtige kleur, met bescheiden witte schuimkraag. Veel gistdepot, net als bij de Stille Nacht. Geur is zacht kruidig als een dessert met gedroogd fruit als perzik en abrikozen. De smaak is zoet honingachtig, in een perfecte balans en kruidig, met tonen van gedroogde abrikozen en zachte specerijen als kaneel, met zoete tonen van de kandij. De afdronk is licht zoet en kruidig met zachte hoptonen. De Dulle Teve is een voortreffelijke tripel waarbij het stevige alcoholpercentage van 10% goed is verborgen. Dit bier heeft een aangename en herkenbare geur en smaak, die lijkt op de Stille Nacht van de Dolle Brouwers, alleen iets kruidiger en minder complex. Het is een echte tripel met een uniek eigen smaakpallet, een aanrader voor de liefhebber van tripel bieren.
33 cl @ bottle. Fantastica tripel by De Dolle. Profumata, dolce e beverina. Davvero ottima.

4 oz pour on draft at B Side. Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of flora, citrus fruit and peel, light honey. Tastes of stone fruit, pineapple and tropical fruit, floral, herbs, spice. Medium-light body with a dry finish.
Une bière qui sort du lot ! Une amertume bien présente et un arrière goût intense. Une merveille !!
это пиво очень вкусно. я бы, конечно, рекомен& его всем. пожалуй& обратит& его. очень хорошо!

330ml bottle. pours quite hazy yellowish amber with a huge off white head. leaves tons of lacing. aroma is balanced between sweet caramel and citrussy hops with a bit of yeast. nice smooth mouth feel. alcohol is completely hidden by a slightly sweet caramelly nutty taste.

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl
@ XXXII The Great Power of Beer & Wine.
A: Golden / Dorado
T/S: Yeast, malt, sweet, alcohol / Levadura, malta, dulce, alcohol

Bronze-gold with pretty good head. Sticky toffee and raisin aroma, but not as dark/burnt as a dubbel. This is hot and syrupy in a good way somehow. The smaller the sip, the slower the drink, the richer the flavor. A bit clingy on the palate (not stage 5), but overall solid beer.

Bottle from Wine of Galilee in Tallinn. Bottled July 2014. Loads of bits floating in the bottle. Creamy white head forms 90% of the pour. Sediments in the glass despite being careful. Cloudy golden colour. Good retention. Thick lacing. Nose maaaan thats nice! Caramelly sour milk (or keefir?), kama alcohol most definitely there, not hiding anywhere, and theres yeast the sour milk thing recedes later on, and it gets more sharp, kind of like orange peel and overall citrusy. Someone said parmesan - cant disagree, its got a strange pungency damn interesting, damn good. Taste is, well, less intriguing - sweet, fruity, doughy (but not as much as your usual Belgian), slightly spicy. Body medium plus, carbonation moderate. Beautifully balanced, considerably hoppy with a lot of thick sweetness (but not syrupy or sugary). This freak is awesome.

grass, earthy, golden, brown, orange, frothy, white foam, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, lively, bitter, astringent, overall light and refreshing would have again and recommend to a friend

Flasche (33 cl) von Getränkefeinkost Berlin. - Orangegelb, trüb mit unschönen Schwebteilchen; wenig Schaum. - Nase angenehm malzsüßlich und matt herb-fruchtig mit süßen Rosinen und Waldhonig. - Antrunk gedämpft herbfruchtig (Pfirsichkern) und ungeniert kandiszuckersüß mit Karamel und leichter zitroniger Herbe (Orangenschale). Andeutungen von Moder und überreifen Weintrauben. Mild rezent, vollmundig. Im Abgang milde aber deutliche "englische" Hopfennoten; herb trotz anhaltender Kandissüße. - Interessantes Tripel, das sich gegenüber einem herkömmlichen Tripel durch Andeutungen von Moder und muffiger Schärfe auszeichnet, ohne auf die typischen Tripel-Zutaten plakative Kandissüße und fruchtige Herbe zu verzichten.

An exceptional beer, and probably my favorite tripel. The appearance is a standard belgian honey tripel, which I always like. The aroma is also somewhat standard with candied sugars, belgian yeast malt. The taste is a bit bitter but has some nice sweetness to it and some tang, maybe orange peel. Initislly this hits you as just another tripel, but after a bit the palate feeling is nothing short of heavenly. Incredibly smooth, creamy, and very very light with a touch of fruity freshness that is one of a kind. Overall an exceptional beer and top of its class for sure.

Gonna be hard pressed to find a tripel tastier than this. A bit of funk, almost farmhouse like upfront, met with soft carbonation, lemon, grass, lovely Belgian candied sugar, some clove, coriander, slight bitterness, orange peel, raisins. Hazy gold with 1-finger head, partly creamy. Love.

Bottle at Fermentoren. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aromas of orange peel, raisins, dates, malts, caramel, some coffee, citrus. Taste is orange peel, malts, caramel, dates, figns, raisins, slight hops.
Very big head. Lots of yeast in the glass. Aroma of bread and yoghurt, also some dried plums. Tastes like peaches, a bit silty. Also some rasins, a bit alcoholic. Sweet.

Cloudy yellow with as much frothy pale-yellow head as beer in the glass. Lots of brown sediment @ the bottom of the pour. Aroma is cheesy, farmy grass, Parmesan, moss, earth. Body is light, oily, heavy carbonation with strong, hot burn which obscures most other elements of the mouth feel. flavor is spicy hops - oregano-type herbs, twigs, hot on the exhale, satisfying dry wheat-scone. Dry, earthy bitterness. An earthy take on the tripel with considerable hopping. Aroma could convey more deliciousness.

0,33L bottle, Appearance: golden body with off-white head. The head has a good retention.
Aroma : sweet, fruits, citrus, fresh apples,pears, grapes spices. 
Taste: Sweet fruits apples, pears ,grapessome citrus and some caramel with some decent bittereness and spices in the finish. Alcohol doesnt show up . 
Full body, average carbonation.

Bottle from Beergusto web shop. Unclear dark golden color with huge white head. Malty aroma with herbal hops, spices, candy. Sweet malty taste with fruity sourness, biscuits, coriander, clove, alcohol. Strong alcoholic finish. Overall well balanced beer. Tasty.

bottled. lightly hazed orange colour with a fluffy head; aroma of pancake dough, menthol, green peppercorns; some pineapple upside-down cake sweetness well balanced by some weedy, citric hop presence, medium bitterness with some yeast bite. delicious

33cl teku. Pours an enormous, creamy and homogeneous head, hazy orange slight golden colour; incredibly lasting and compact head. Smells malty, mature fruits, syrupy peaches, some really really fine and complex yeasty with a slight and pleasant acidic note, subtle alcohol;; wow. Tastes mature fruit, honey, caramel, wood, dates, sweet spiced... so many notes, every time different. Perfect, and dominant, sweetness, just great and never tiring, delicate fruity bitter notes; tart notes in background. Medium body, great moderate carbonation, bit sticky texture. So complex, so full of flavours.. So balanced. An institution between Belgian beers, awesome !!

Hazy amber, thick dense white head. Nose is hops, fruity and sweet notes. Flavor is malty, hoppy bitterness, bubblegum sweetness, warming booze, yeast, spice. Hoppy-malty finish. Oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Exquisite balance, lovely beer. Bottle shared by martjoobolut, thanks!

- Alcoholpercentage van 10%
- Uitstekend biertje destijds gedronken
- Compliment aan de brouwerij- en brouwmeester
- Sluit erg goed bij de smaken die ik zoek in zo'n bier
- Vandaar de hoge beoordeling 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

dorata con abbondante schiuma di una compattezza e persistenza fuori dal comune. al naso sentori di pane e frutta a pasta bianca. in bocca ha una rotondità perfetta grazie al corpo carico e maltato che sposa perfettamente la dolcezza on ingresso e la lieve stringenza finale. buonissima.

0,33L bottle, bottled 02.06.2013. Pours golden with off-white head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, fruits, citrus, fresh apples, spices. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, apples, citrus, caramel, and spices. Alcohol is very well covered. Finish is citrus bitter. Everything is very well balanced. Overall: no gimmicks, just a great beer.
Brownish towards red clear with nice white head. Heathland fruit in the aroma. Malt, banana toffee with alcoholic toffee aftertaste. Higj in carbon.

Beautiful tripel. Intense fruitiness kick, mostly oranges, citrus, quite noticeable yeast, bit sharp, but thats perfectly enough to make it complex, but in same time very refreshing. Lovely caramel malty background. Good balance between quite intense sweetness and bitterness
Very enjoyable brew.
Interesting aroma. Quite complex pear and malt notes. Very sweet on taste, perfect triple for me. Awesome!

Bottle at de dolle brewery. Cloudy amber, frothy white head. Sour, a little apple and white pear in the nose as well as some yogurt, sweetish apple taste and an astringent sensation in the mouth and down the throat. Full body, fizzy, sweet candy finish. Quite alright.

September 26, 2014. Bottle at home, bottled april 2014. Pours hazy orange with a large, slowly dissipating, white head. Aroma is sweet with pear, plums, almond, sugar and spices. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, almond, spices and light alcohol. Medium bodied, average to fizzy carbonation.

A really great tripel, the phenolic thing isnt too prevalent and theres a nice light sweetness throughout that accompanies the yeasty spice notes well. Typical great De Dolle interpretation of a style Im not crazy for.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 330ml bottle served in a Trapping glass.
A: Pours a cloudy orange to amber color forming a medium creamy white head. Good retention. Never disappears completely leaving a thin layer and many lacings around
S: Very fruity in the nose. Plums and pears mainly with notes of caramel malts, honey and bready yeasts 
T: Follows the nose. Very sweet and fruity upfront. Notes of caramel, caramel malts and bread. Honey and citrus hops in the end
M: Heavy and bit molasses body. Medium carbonation. Malty and slightly bitter aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Great beer. De Dolle quality
[ BA Review @ 10/19/2012 ]

Pours a cloudy light brown brew with a medium beige head with moderate retention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with orange, clove, banana and caramel, robust bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with a bittersweet finish and a long aftertaste, very good.

Single bottle from Yankee in Sturbridge. Poured into a snifter. A very murky light orange-amber with a frothy off-white head. Very complex aroma and flavors. Sweet plum-bread, dry yeast, good hopping, some spice, some citrus. Slightly sweet. Some herbal notes. Very smooth too. Incredible.

Like most triples this Mad Bitch is bold rich and full of flavor. Still with this one you also think luxurious and refined. Colour is nice hazy yellow with a good creamy head and soft prickly carbonation. Flavor is sweet malts licorice yeast bitter hops and some of the 10%. Delicious.
33cl bottle. Pours hazy brown with a huge, long lasting white head. Aroma is moderate yeasty, sweet, spicy, citrus. Flavor is a bit sharp, acidic, moderate sweet, light bitter. yeasty and spicy.

Atoms of hay, malt and hops. Cloudy amber color with a lasting white well laced head. Moderate carbonation with a viscous buttery feel. Taste of malt, syrup and hops. Finish of malt and Belgian yeast.

Clear amber with off-white lacing lasting foam head. Hoppy barley aroma, some hay notes. Quite sweet taste for a tripel, but then they added sugar to it. Can believe this beer matures well. Small bitter aftertaste. (Velp 201409)

Bottle 0.33l from from Dranken Geers Ghent Belgium.Pour it yellow colour with small white head.On the nose Banana bread.Taste of hops, Belgian yeast and bread.Very good carbonation.Good fermentation.Wonderful
Bottle from Speciaalbierpakket in Leiden. Cloudy orange beer with lots of yeast. Incredibly smooth for 10% ABV. Sweet and fruity taste. Excellent triple

Poured from a bottle into a snifter slightly cloudy golden honey with a white head.
Aroma is fruited sugar.
Flavor is WOW subtle bitterness with prominent sweet candied sugar malt. An outstanding tripel quite smooth & nice to the palate.
Tap, Taphouse. Light, yeasty, citrus fruity aroma. Flavour is big, mellow. Light spicy and boozy. Peaches and orange.

The mad bitch, Dolles unsubmissive tripel since 1993, originally a commissioned beer. Firm, thick, off-white head, quickly decreasing under the influence of the alcohol content. Deep orange blonde colour, misty. The nose is treated with a strong smell of orange juice and orange liqueur, richly perfumed with flowery hops, honey, caramel candy, vanilla, apple peel, jute, dried ginger, peppermint, nutmeg, grass, pineapple. Sweet onset with lots of caramel malts and orange, strong carbonation, smooth, evolving into a rewarding dry, flowery and herbal hop bitterness, supported by a lot of warming alcohol, on the brink of becoming astringent but just managing to remain undisturbing. Keeps well in the cellar too, certainly for a Dolle beer, which are usually at their best when cracking fresh from tap at the brewery itself.
@ Omena Hotels, Copenhagen. Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Aroma: Fruity, banana, citrus peel, fresh. Taste: Dito. The finish is dry and medium bitter with fruity notes.
Een goede tripel, er zijn er betere, maar er zijn zeker ook heel veel slechtere dan dit te vinden

Cloudy amber with a soft, white head. Floaties! The aroma has strong fruit, reminds me of an apple fig newton. Also has some sweet alcohol, toasted sugar, and pear esters. The flavor is intense. Sweet toasted biscuit, bread crust, light carameln toffee, apple, alcohol, and spices. Finishes a touch tart, on the sweeter side of balanced. Pretty good but different.

How: bottle

 Where: la mi graine, Lyon, France

 Appearance: hazy amer with withe head

 Aroma: malty,fruit, spicy

 Body: medium body

 Flavours: spicy, floral, malty, Light bitterness, alcoholic note

@ Omena Hotels, Copenhagen. Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Malty, yeasty and fruity with light spicy notes, sweet with some alcoholic notes, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and yeasty.

Bottle @ t Poatersgat, Brugge. Pours cloudy lightish amber with stable white head. Clear aroma of fruit, malt and flowers, with notes of hops. Booze in the long nose. Sweet flavour of caramel malt and fruit, complemented rich notes of hops and flowers. Rough and swetish afteraste. Warming alcohol presence, permeating every aspect of the tasting experience, but it is well-integrated. Nice. Very nice.
33cl bottle thanks to ruigo. Color is dark gold. Head is thin and white. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter. Aroma is dried fruits, fresh fruits, light yeast, caramel.

12oz bottle pours cloudy toasted orange with 2 finger head. Nose is fruity citrus, earthy yeast, dough, grains, orange, spice. Taste is doughy malt fruit, nice yeasty spice, peppery hay and grains, touch of fruity booze, orange zest, madarin orange, wheat, cereal, touch of apple. Finish is dry bitter doughy fruit and mild yeast spice with occasional semi-sweet touches of malt and citrus. The best and most interesting Tripel I have tried.
Golden, heavy and persistent head, high carbonation. High fusels on the aroma, orange. Taste: sweet in the beginning, orange and bitterness from the hops and the orange peel. Medium body.
Pours hazy golden yellow. Lots of white head. Initial aroma is very grapey, reminiscent of grape soda. Huge, full body. Very thick, almost slimy texture. Bittersweet. Very good.

Hazy golden straw color with thick head. Aroma is full of citrus and lemon. Taste is nice and complex, with round grainy notes and citrus in the back, along with a hint of grape soda. Full of body, though perhaps a tad overcarbonated. Very nice (and will go great with our pizza.)

Bottle 0.33l at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Bottled FEB 2014. Colour is deep orange with very small bubbly white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, spices, raisins, some sweetness and malts. Very soft and juicy.

Shared a 33cl bottle. Pours a hazy light amber colour with a thin white head. Aroma is yeasty, citrus, wheat, spicy, malty, caramel and fruity. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter, with a dry sweet finish. Overall, a very complex beer with different dimensions and very tasteful.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2014 Classic golden Tripel color, with some sediments and a standard white foam. Intense fruity aroma, with citrus, banana and yeast. In mouth, lemon and orange are very present, accompanied with hops that give it a slight bitterness. High carbonation. An amazing one!

33 cl, flaske, 10,0 % ABV, købt i Kvickly Allerød i.f.m. et belgisk ølforedrag, 26. maj 2014. 
Fantastisk syn at åbne og ophælde denne Abbey Tripel! Øllet er gyldent, men dét, man lægger mærke til, er den kæmpe mæssige hvide skumkrone på 7-9 cm, der fint lægger sig i glasset. Småboblende og fin hvid, næsten som æggehvide! Langsomt langsomt "falder" kronen ned til ca. 4 cm, mens der spreder sig en duft af banan og eksotisk frugt såsom papaya og god kraftig alkohol. 
Majestætisk smag! Meget fin balance mellem bitterhed og sødme og en meget kompleks øl. Der er den fine sødme, som dominerer i starten og dernæst kommer den gærende og malt/humlede bitterhed og slutter smagen af. Med den varmende alkohol fra de 10 %. Iøvrigt har den "dalende" skumkrone nu dannet det mest fantastiske snelandskab i overfladen. 
Kuldioxid indholdet i brygget ligger fint i samspil med øltypen: lettere nedskruet i.f.t. medium, men ikke så meget at øllet ikke føles friskt. 
En verdensklasse øl og -Tripel, som man ikke må gå uden om.

330ml bottle, pours hazy golden brown. Complex aroma with sweet malt, honey, banana, yeast, orange, mandarin, a bit of nuttiness. Finish is balanced and the alcohol is well hidden. Nice unfiltered tripel with lots of complexity and aroma..

Aroma: milky sweets, honey, caramel. Appearance: hazy pale gold, medium frothy white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: light bitterness on top of the expanding sweets, malts, average-long finish. Overall: fantastic Abbey Tripel, excellent aroma and palate. Pint at The Times, Ypres.

Bottle.
Hazy light amber with a big white head.
Yeasty, sweet, citrus fruit aroma.
Orange, sugary sweetness, herbal/grapefruit bitterness, ripe banana, slight alcohol heat at the end.
Medium body and carbonation, dry.
Woody (pencil like) dry after taste.

Bottle @Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours hazy, big white head. Some lacing. Aroma is malty, yeast, spices, some wheat. Taste is malty, Belgian yeast, spices, peber, caramel, grapes and white wine notes. Oily at first, then dry. Crisp!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Slightly hazy, big white head that settles nicely, some lacing. Aroma, malty, Belgian yeast, hay, spices, wheat. Taste, malty, Belgian yeast, spices, peber, caramel, grapes (white wine notes), hay. Oily at first, then dry. Medium to high carbonation. Really drinkable.
Draught. Pours light orange gold with a white head. Aroma of white bread, clove. Warm, slight caramel, raisin. Nice.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy light brown pour with big frothy white head, big fruity and spicy aroma, taste is very fruity lots of citrus and pine, some tangerine some yeast action, spice, bananas, quite boozy but well balanced.

Pours murky apricot with a frothy white head. Aroma is citrus, lemongrass, peach, lime. Taste is citrus, lemongrass, peach, lime, grass. Mouth is very crspy with high carbonation. Aftertaste is lemongrass, banana and ctrus.

Bottle poured in Taiwan, off white head with light retention and strong lacing, slightly cloudy light brown appearance with what look like a dash of black pepper at the bottom of the glass. Apparent alcohol and malty nose, prunes, pepper, Chardonnay flavors, creamy full smooth mouthfeel, slight hop finish. Reminiscent of DFH 90 minute... without the hops.

Hazy amber color with heavy sedimentation. Very malty which is noticeable from the very beginning. Yeast flavor doesnt emerge until beer warms up butonce it does is very smooth. Caramel sweetness and fresh bread dominate the aroma. This us one if the beers that has more complexity in the flavor than the nose. A bit of hop bitterness and booze burn in the middle. Finished sweet and yeasty. Good beer and not God tier thoigh
Flesje 33cl, oranje geel van kleur, strakke witte schuimkraag. Smaak is goed, heel goed. Complexe tripel. Heerlijk fris van smaak. Mijn absoluut favoriete tripel.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 33cl bottle served in a Delirium Tremens glass. Pours a cloudy dark straw colour with a thick foamy head. Mouthfeel is perfect and carbonation just so. Taste has sweet fruits and a hint of floweryness perfectly balanced with a lingering bitterness. I have since tried this twice (from the same shop in Belgium) and it was clearly old stock - dark golden colour and toffee-like sticky palate akin to Struise XXX tripel. This is very much an example of a beer that is best at its youngest if you want to experience the fragrant and light flavours.

Drunk from 33cl bottle bought at Malting pot, Brussels. Strong!!
 
 
 
 
 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle into a goblet. There is no age stamped on the cap but judging by the other De Dolle beers at the liquor store, this one is probably around 2008 vintage.

Pours a very dirty dark gold with lots of specks in it. However the head is a very billowy, frothy bright white with a few specks of yeast so I have to give it some credit for that.

Right off the bat in the aroma I can tell this beer has some age. The sherry/wet cardboard note of oxidation is quite present and overpowers anything else. Apple is very strong along with notes of plums and dark fruit; sort of out of character for a triple.

The flavor continues the oxidized notes. More apple and plums along with sherry. The oxidation character starts to become a little too much as the flavor lingers. There is almost a touch of smokiness about it but not in a real good way. This beer definitely does not have the characteristics of a Tripel that I was expecting. Mouthfeel is quite sticky; not dry like I was hoping for.

Overall, I feel like this beer is a bit past its prime. I was hoping to get a nice, aged beer but this one has been on the shelf a bit too long. Hopefully I will be able to try a fresh sample one day.

Poured at tasting. This was golden and cloudy. Aroma, as taste was light. I got a fruity aroma, light on the nose. I have to admit I dont know what to make of the aroma. Taste was like aroma, fuity, sweet and very light. Some yeast in the finish. Not my favorite Belgium because of its lightness.

330ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours a dark brown with next to no carbonation and no lacing. Perhaps this batch didnt turn out so well? Pretty bizarre fruity, sweet, chocolatey aroma.. taste brings toffee sponge, chocolate, brown sugar and fruit cake with a little orange juice zest. Not your typical tripel at all and quite honestly ive have never tasted anything like it. Mad bitch indeed.
Bottle. Amber with a white head. Dry grass aroma and a bit of sweetness. I taste honey, malt, light banana and a little bit of sugar.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330 ml bottle at home. Pours orangy yellow with a very thin simmering off-white head. Complex nose of peach, some caramel, spicy notes (peperkoek) - and nice banana. Huge body with nice sweet notes, a bit of bitterness and even sourness. Taste of banana (in a good way), caramel and butter. Thick and nice. Top beer - nest Belgian tripel!
Bottle from Beer Mania. Citrus, orange-juice, banana, butterscotch, honey and cola.
Fresh bottle. Pours hazy gold with tall white head. Nice aroma of passion fruit, grapefruit. Taste is sweet - syrupy, cotton candy, orange and grapefruit. A thoroughly smooth beer.

0,33l fles, oranje goud kleurig troebel met een witte kraag, redelijk stabiel. Geur is gist en zoetzuur, appels met banaan. Smaak is naast zoet ook een tikkeltje zuur, mooie balans met appeltaart en witte wijn als nasmaak, die goed blijft hangen. Nice

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes oranges Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, alkoholisch, Nüsse, Früchte.
Geschmack sehr süß malzig, dunkle Früchte, hefig, leicht alkoholisch.

Though they may fall into the category of triple but its a good beer to say that Strong Ale 10% alcohol. The body of a full-body type is suitable to drink slowly over time. A great finish of the beer geek favorite, was delight around with tongue very much taste.

Bottle at Rose Red, Bruges. Pours cloudy orange to golden with nice lasting white head. Aroma is orange and yeast - lots of both. Flavor is bitter and slightly sour with yeast, orange, spices, chocolate, malt, wheat.

Draft to taster at Dutchs. Looks good for the style; a mostly transparent honey orange with foamy eggshell head that slowly dissipates into sticky lacing. Smells of mild Belgian yeast and tropical fruit with a mildly sweet backbone. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. Its been awhile since Ive enjoyed an example of this style, but this one is well-balanced (not too sweet) and enjoyable.

Cor laranja turva com espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma de caramelo, cítrico, grapefruit, frutas amarelas e fermento. No sabor, boa carbonatação, com dulçor médio, adstringente, baixo amargor, seca ao final. Amargor e calor da alto teor alcoólico persiste ao final. Muito boa! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2014  Pours clear golden colour with sturdy two-finger head. Aroma is fascinating: white grape and apple (almost prosecco in tone) sat on atop some yeast. There is also a faint hint of earthy, bitter hops. Palate is soft and consistent. Sweet citrus up front, replaced by yeast and earthy hops. Rising bitterness on the back end. 
Despite 10% alc it is camouflaged. Almost like the conventional Triples refreshing summer cousin.

Copper, fairly clear but with some sediment bits, fluffy white head. Aroma of bready malt, light fruits of strawberry and pear, some plum-like notes, earthy spice and leather. Flavor: earthy spice, brown sugar, herbal notes, leather, moderate spicy bitterness, fruity notes of plum, pear. Complex and unique earthy character.

De Dulle Teve is brewed in the tradition of a Belgian Triple. Its high density stems from large amounts of pale malt increased with pale candi sugar in the brew kettle. Unfiltered, unpasteurized, bottle-conditioned.

De Dulle Teve keeps two to three years without major changes in taste. Further maturing, up to 10 years, will cause it to darken a little and lose some of its bitterness. The bittering of about 30 IBU is due to Goldings hops in the brew kettle.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Look: clear amber with a huge white rocky head with good retention.
Aroma: mostly fruity, white grapes, fermenting apples, cidery acidity, apple vinegar, funky, spice.
Taste: again mostly fruity, white grapes, peppery/phenolic, dry, white wine, light slightly aldehydic bitterness.

A great tripel. Love the cidery fruitiness!

Bottiglia 33cl @ giangaspero frutta e verdura.
chiara con schiuma spettacolare.
Belga con un bel carattere amaro
Bottle. Hazy yellow, green orange pour with a lot of white head. Banana, spice, consommé, herb, lemon, basil. Good carbonation in a medium body with sweet bitter finish
floral, citrus, herbs, alcohol, orange, white foam, medium bitterness, light sweetness, bitter, average carbonation, oily feel, medium body,
Orange color with luscious foam production. Fruity yeast aroma. Complex taste. Fruit, spicy, alcohol and bitter finish.

Pours an orange amber with a big white head. Aroma apple, Belgian yeast, fruity alcohol . Taste of Belgian yeast, fruity flavor of peach, dried plums sweetness and a mild tartness, sweet alcohol. Palate is a med to full body with sweet tart Belgian yeast and moderate carbonation.

Pours a darker orange than normal tripels with no head or lace. Aroma apples and pears with light acidity and bread yeast. Flavor is juicy, herbal, and of an off putting cedar. Feel is slick with little life. Would probably be good with food.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Orange amber beer with a residual head. Aroma of yeast, tangerines and spices. Taste is dry malts, sweet sugar, spices, tangerines, yeast and a little sour fruit drops. Light and oily with a good amount of carbonation. Very good beer.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle to tulip
Sweet malt, tropical fruit, slight citrus, and honey
Cloudy reddish amber, thick long lasting creamy white head
Sweet apricot,lots if malt.
Creamy mouthfeel

Bottle at Doll Dress in Osaka. Aromas of condensed sweet fruit, candi sugar, and light yeast. Beautiful golden straw color, with a thick fluffy ice cream cone head, and lovely gentle carbonation streaming up slowly. Initial is creamy, and very sweet with candied fruit / bittering kicks in and then the sweetness intensifies / finish is smooth, fruity, and full of alc. warmth. Medium-heavy body. A superb tripel.

Wonderful tripel. Lots of orange, florals and a touch of booze in aroma. Some light apricot. Pours cloudy orange with great head and lacing, looks great for style. Finishes with light sweetness, some bitterness. Very nice palate, nice mix. Bottle Ive been waiting too long to drink.

Pepinaco!!!
Aroma, bonito color dorado, espuma blanca, burbujita y persistente. Es una belga alcohólica, con ese cuerpo y sabor propia de las trapenses.
Pepinaco!!!!

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, non mais quelle tuerie, cette bière est absolument phénoménale, une richesse aromatique et gustative énorme, et ne parlons pas de la teneur parfaite de la mousse, une des meilleure, si ce nest la meilleure triple que jai bu, ROYAL

Ar: Grainy pils malt, peach and orange rind - hay, mineral water.
Ap: Slightly hazy orange - huge off-white head with excellent retention - bloomy and airy head, with chunky lacing along the sides.
T: Peach and tart orange - medium-low sweetness - lean, mineral water - hay, some refined lemon-lime - herbal hop flavor, medium-high bitterness.
P: Light body with high, fully carbonation - finish is very dry.
O: An wonderful tripel - dry, fruity, and herbal - marked minerality and hay, very rustic.

330 ml bottle shared with the metallurgist. Golden yellow with white head. Aroma mainly of Belgian yeast, candy, bananas and other esters, but the yeast dominates. Taste is powerful and pleasant, malt, yeast and esters in a nice balance.
On tap at TJs. Pours a cloudy copper with white head. Aromas of light fruit, basement, orange, bread, cloves. Very sweet like most beers from De Dulle. Lightly bitter. Full, sticky body.

draft taster. bright yellow color with white head. the aroma of Belgian yeast, candies, bananas, esters, brilliant on the nose. strong yet subtle the flavor was more of the same and ever so smooth and wonderful. the Belgian flavors comes through in the medium bodied beer. another one for the top list. so tasty on the tongue you just want more.
De barril. Color dorado turbio. Buen gas. Aroma a azúcar y fruta madura, algo de alcohol. En boca, dulce pero algo de acidez al final, muy frutal y fresca. El alcohol bien escondido. Muy rica.

Bottle bought some place I dont remember. Pours hazy deep golden with a big frothy white head that quickly dissipates while leaving a small trace on the glass. Smell is estery with oatmeal cookies, alcohol, green apples, baked pears, banana bread, lemon zest, apricots, bitter orange zest, marzipan, white bread, golden syrup, hay and hints of glue. Taste is sweet, tiny sour, estery, phenolic and malty with crackers, white bread, oatmeal cookies, banana bread, alcohol, hay, bitter oranges, cloves, white pepper corns, dry wood, baked pears covered in marzipan and brandy, overripe apples and orange zest. Mouthfeel is soft, round, creamy, tiny spicy astringent, tingling boozy, tiny dry and medium to full bodied. Finish is tiny sweet and tiny bitter with oatmeal cookies, baked pears with marzipan, bitter oranges, hay, white pepper corns, alcohol and banana bread. A great tripel that really packs an onslaught on all senses.
Color dorado tupido con espuma blanca densa. Aromas afrutados de manzana, pomelo. En boca entra fresca y dulce y avanza hacia un acidez moderada, todo ello bien afrutado. Excelente.
Aroma: Grass, citrus, yeast, cheesy Appearance: Gold, hazy, fine foam and lace, clear white head Taste: Grass, spruce, bit of fruit, soft carbonation, well hidden alcohol, one of my favorite triples
UPDATED: DEC 21, 2013 Encore un coup de maître de chez De Dolle. À goûter absolument, on en redemande.
Nice orange color. Mainly fruits and bitter orange. Very rich but not overwhelming beer. Bitterness is balanced, but not perfect.
Golden yellow.Fruity, citric, malty and yeasty. Very strong and robust, yet smooth to drink.

A: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, White Head Ring, Decent Lacing

S: Yeast, Mild Bready Malts

T: Light Cane Sugar, Sweet Bread, Belgian Yeast

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Dirty (its unfiltered), Lightly Sweet

Overall, a decent triple that isnt boozy, nice cane sugar taste but the yeast is everywhere.

Aroma of sharp Goldings hops, new leather. Pours a hazy unfiltered orange. Taste full but not overwhelming, rounded by candied sugars but sweetness is measured. Extremely well balanced with a short, mild and quietly vanishing finish. A hill and a smooth ride..

Bottle on the train from Hereford to Inverness, thanks to an IP trade with Vincent, 18/10/13.
Murky orange amber with a thin off white covering.
Nose is tangy fruits, light booze, bitter orange, pinch of spice.
Taste comprises bitter orange, yeast esters, touch of booze, caramelised sugars.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, lgiht booze at the curtain call/
Decent tripel.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On tap at Biercab. Orange colour with white head. Fruity, malty aroma. Fruity, peach and grapefruit, sweet taste, some malt and slightly bitter. Full body.

Knappt två år gammal flaska från Khioskh delad med Daniel. Stor doft av söta äpplen och päron, gula russin och gula plommon. Smaken är också mycket fruktig i linje med doften, krispig, viss beska som stramar upp sötman väl. Lätt och robust på samma gång, perfekt balans, en väldigt lyckad trippel.

Knappt två år gammal flaska från Khioskh delad med Petrus. Gyllenfärgad, lätt disig, poröst vitt skum. Stor doft av söta äpplen och päron, gula russin och gula plommon. Smaken är också fruktig i linje med doften, krispig, viss beska som stramar upp sötman väl. Lätt och robust på samma gång, perfekt balans, en väldigt lyckad trippel.

Ambrée trouble, léger dépôt en suspension, effervescence moyenne, col blanc épais et crémeux. De bons malts caramel sont suivis par des notes de fruits de style pêche et mirabelle, une amertume houblonnée et une présence dalcool qui nenvahit pas le palais malgré un ABV pour le moins élevé.

Rated from beer log during 2009 Belgium trip... Dark golden orange, light foamy yellow white head... Sour tart and citrusy aroma, can't stop smelling it... Appropriately sweet, very citrusy flavor... Sweet sugary finish, slightly yeasty and bitter on palate... Alcohol not terribly apparent... A citrusy trippel, really good

33cl bottle from CANBIF Fall 2013, 2012 vintage. Clear vibrant amber with a stiff slightly off white head. Very fruity, peach blossoms and liquor, lots of esters, sweet, candied lemon zest. Mild carbonation, moderate body, lots of alcohol, quite sweet but some underlying bitterness that grows quite strong, somewhat dry, promising but think I want this to be a little older as I imagine it would balance out a little more...who knows though.
10% 500 yen at Ohtsuki shared with Ajen.  Wow what a strong orange peel aroma, sweet & boozy taste, sour and spicy. You definitely feel the alcohol! Not my style... But I loved the aroma.

Heavy floral and citrus aromas. Thick white head with good lacing. Full bodied great tasting Tripel. Truly one of my favorite beers of all time.

En hel del jäst. Mycket bra balans, Någon mörk frukt. Sviskon kanske har smygit sig in?
God sak med toner av sviskon, torkat hö och lakrits. Kroppen var stabil och balansen för tillfredställande.

33cl bottle. poured a hazzy amber colour with a good white head. fruits as peach en grapes in the aroma. and floral yeast. taste is real sweet of the peach. some syrup sugar with some bread tones. bit boozy.

330ml bottle. Minimally cloudy golden colour with absurdly huge, frothy, fully lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Sweetish fruity aroma has notes of apricot, peach, mirabelle. Taste is moderately sweet fruity, apricot, peach, mirabelle, in fresh and dried form, oats, muesli, slightly spicy yeasty overtones, some warming alcohol in the finish; oily texture, sticky palate.

330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy amber with medium head of big bubbles. Aromas of lemons, light malts and ripe yellow fruit. Flavours of candied fruit, light bananas, toasted malts, and light spice/ginger.
33cl bottle 10% abv. golden colour, fluffy foam. fruity oily taste with alcohol and biting acidity. aftertaste is dry with hint of plums. this is a killer triple.

Pours a rusty orange amber with a medium white head. Aroma ripe apple, pears, Belgian yeast, fruity alcohol esters, some dark fruit notes as it warms up. Taste of Belgian yeast, fruity flavor of dark fruit, dried plums sweetness and a mild tartness, sweet alcohol. Palate is a med to full body with sweet tart Belgian yeast and moderate carbonation. Finish is of sweet ripe dark fruit, dried sweet tart plums, Belgian yeast, with mild bitterness and sweet alcohol. Overall a very good, tasty and all around flavorful brew, very nice

at bierhuiske
pours clear blonde, big white head . smell is typical tripel . grainy, some sweetness.taste is sugary , intence, grains, bit boozyness, tripel to the maximum . nice
Bottle from a bottle shop in Belgium. Fruity and with a nice yeasty aroma. Very boozy. Light body. Some apples and a light malty body. A bit boozy for my taste, but besides that nice.
Bottled in June 2013 pours a light hazy gold with big white head. Yeast aroma. Mild citrus with a bit of a apple spice.
Bottle at Beergeek. Golden cloudy ale with big white head. Fresh greenapple aroma, light fresh citric taste with touche of bitterness. Awesome drinkability.

330ml bottle bought at Craftissmo in Tsim Sha Tsui East.
Colour: Cloudy hazy dull light straw brown, with lots of scrappy, dirt-like brownish yeast sediments.

Looks: Explosive three finger head with lasting, crumpety off white foams. Very sticky lacing and fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and very dark fruit-driven which can be smelt more than half a foot away, including very strong plums, figs, raisins, candy sugar, perfume, floral, strong Belgian yeast, malt, spices, and light alcohol. 

Taste: Very rich and fulfilling sweet bliss of plums, raisins, dark fruits, blossoms and Belgian yeast, with malts, molasses, spices, light liquorices, light citrus and light herbal hops.

Body: Full body, rich and very slick palate.

Mouth Feel: an incredibly nice and rich plum and figs plus nice flowers, with the kind of matching good strong sweetness you know that only works in strong Belgian brews, and it makes me happy. :) Theres more: strong yeasty taste thanks to a hefty dose of scappy brown yeasts provides a good balance for the sweet taste, yummy!

Booze: Lightly-tasted all the way. 10%? I sure dont feel that at all throughout the session. A telling sign of a top brew. 

Hoppiness: rather low and muted, in total contrast with the likes of Westmalle Tripel and Chimay White. Mostly floral nose, hint of citrus plus spicy herbal hop taste, and fairly light but palatable bitterness for a satisfying finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry after taste. Pleasantly sweet, rich and easy to mouth.

Comments: Saved this one for my 300th RB rating and what a wise choice Ive made :) This is in many aspect an excellent Tripel / BSA - incredibly rich and fragrant dark fruit and floral nose and taste, matching sweetness and light booze, and a good strong dose of Belgian yeast. Wow, what an experience! It may not have the customary banana and caramel elements, but its no longer important in this case. Mad Bitch? Im just as mad as you! A winner!

P.S. Thanks for the Chicken Dance video for my 300th ratings. Thanks a lot!
The Dolle Brouwers always manage to give their beers a special touch. This tripel has a strong and dominant taste of malt and yeasty sugar. Its a rich beer, full of good ingredients.
Poured from a bottle it is a murky golden with a large white head. The aroma is bready and the taste is sweet some honey and a lovely after taste

From a 33 cl bottle shared at home. Pours a hazy gold with a massive off white head. Yeasty aroma. Flavors of toffee and candi sugar with some mild citrus. Effervescent with a moderately bitter finish.

UPDATED: JUL 28, 2015 Bottle @ De Dolle, Esen - Color: clear golden blond beer with copper reflexion, medium carbonation, big white foam and yeast particles. Smell: nice caramel and sweet candy nose. Nice candied fruits and malt balance. Small spicy and yeast finish. Taste: nice body with good carbonation. Notes of candy and candied fruits as apricot. Well balanced with good bitter hops. Very nice taste. Aftertaste: strong malt taste with candy and good dry bitterness. Alcohol finish.

Pours with massive head, distinct Belgian yeast smell with light fruit. Sharpness of the smell is less prevalent in a tangier, tart apple taste. Bitter too - definitely 10% alcohol, but enjoyably so. Very full body. Not usually a tripel fan, but this has a lot more character than most. Definitely one to try for any Belgian fan. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at Pub St. Alexandre, Quebec City. A fabulous tripel. Sweet, boozy, bready, kind of a little syrup vs. the usual lively palate of these beers. Overall, very tasty.

Intense juicy fruit with brown sugar and white pepper spice, moving into white vinous notes and honey drizzled pear with warmth

A hazed dried apricot body with lively carbonation beneath a tall, initially frothy rocky head, which tightens as it settles into a smooth, cool whip like 1/2" resilient cap and a single peninsula of lace
-
Juicy tropical and white fruit complexities are accompanied by brown sugar, white pepper, and a solid layer of sweet malt from a medium, slightly chewy body with solid carbonation; white wine characteristics are introduced as each sip closes out, moving into a drying, spicy finish; as this nears 60º, the white vinous notes grow into the aroma and initial flavor to balance the big, juicy fruit characteristics which transform into honey drizzled pear

11.5oz bottle at 45º into 17 1/2 oz Bormioli Rocco Riserva Cal Gran Bourgogne
Golden ale with a white frothy head. Fruity aroma with mild spice notes. Sweet, malty, sugary with little bitterness. Alcohol is there but hidden well by the sweetness.
On tap at Whole Foods Taproom. Pours a fawn color with a light head and a bit of a haze. Sweet and fruity and slight hoppiness. Excellent triple.

Es una delicia de cerveza. Color anaranjado, con una espuma color beige muy viva al principio y luego algo pegajosa. Olor a madera, pino, flores, jazmín. Sabor cítrico, a cáscara de naranja, a piña, caramelo, almendra, y también especias como romero. Sorprende la evolución del sabor a medida que pasa por la boca se va dejando un fondo más amargo y presencia alcohólica en la garganta. Mejor no tomarla muy fría. Lo mejor de esta belgian tripel es el perfecto equilibrio entre gas, cuerpo, densidad, alcohol y sabores. Repito, una delicia.

Appearance:
Deep orange under a pithy head which lingers as a thin film with thick edges that try to crawl up the sides of my glass.

Nose:
Acidic in the back with slightly fermented fresh citrus and fruits  pears, apricots, kiwi, green grapes, and honeydew. Meaty chewy sourdough in the middle. Grape musk. Banana peel and aloe plant. Ginger, fennel, and star anise.

Palate:
Hits with spice  ginger, fennel, and star anise. Wine and oak  pinot grigio and oaked chardonnay for some nice caramel notes. Grape musk in the back. Sticky stewed kiwi and honeydew. Rustic underneath with green banana peel. Big and bold, delicate and complex. Yeasty doughy sourdough bread in the middle for some chew and to help soak up all the flavors. A bit more ginger in the back.

Final Thoughts:
Another intense beer from the mad brewers of Belgium. My bottle was from May 2010 so it had some nice age to it which proved not in the least way detrimental to my enjoyment. Delicious.

Pours golden amber with two fingers foamy white head. Smells of yeast and citrus. Tastes of yeast, fruit, and mild hops. Has high carbonation and long flavor on the tongue.

Golden with nice white head. Aroma of yiest, citrus. Alcohol is present. Good beer.

330ml bottle. Yesty, some fruity and subtle tart aromas. Pours very hazy, golden, with frothy white head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is fruity, kind of sweet, yeasty, a bit unbalanced.
Clear gold pour with sediment at bottom..funky potent aroma... taste is alcohol and fruit

Bottle at club w.  white head, cloudy amber pour. Lil kick of buttery hops. Really good!!!

33cl bottle. Pours in a very nice golden colour with a decent white head. The alcohol is present. Great smell and great taste.

Bottle.  Clear brown sparkling with a very large head which is still huge 10 minutes after pouring.  Yeasty smell.  Taste - Classic Belgian Tripel -  caramel and raisins, spice, yeast.  Mid flavour intensity.  Mid body.  Drinkable and tasty.

Hazy amber pour. Aromas of malt, yeast, sweet honey, and a touch of hops. I can tell this is going to be an impressive brew already. Nice malty mouthfeel with sweet notes. Really complex and refreshing. I would definitely like to see how this could develop from some cellaring. Solid brew.

Znakomite, tresciwe i wytrawno owocowe piwo z nutami cytrusowymi w tle. Slodkie na poczatku, pikantn i krzepkie. Wielka piana mocna i trwala, spore nagazowane. Piwo jest koloru ciemnej pomaranczy. Bogaty bukiet smakowy i szeroka paleta smakóww od cytruswo po pizmo. Klasyk abbaye tripel, mocny alkohol zaznaczony tylko na finiszu. Polecam.

Glad the bartender told me to try this brew.  Dont want to be that tool in the bar scouring Ratebeer to make his decision, and thus was unaware of this beers stellar reputation.  Poured amber like the color of tree sap.  Smells of honey and hops.  Taste sweet but not too sweet.  A great-ish beer.  Draft - Brick Store Pub - Decatur. GA

Bottle at home (a few years old). It pours cloudy gold with a massive white head. The nose is preserved orange, candied peel, strong aniseed & liquorice, clove, touch of herb and orange liqueur. The taste is zesty orange, apricot, peach, candy, pear, hay, earth, alcohol, good deal of spice, herbal notes, icing sugar and some decent bitterness with a dry, warming finish. Full body and moderate-high carbonation. Pretty tasty, but also rather boozy. To be enjoyed in small measures...

Dark cloudy,milky appearance-head dropped off fairly quickly. Powerful nose-intense oranges-perhaps too intense? Incredibly deep, rich taste-really nice but almost bordering on a liquor? Wouldnt be drinking too many of them in a session but a very nice beer....

First of all, this is very special beer. Nice looking foam one can feel in mouth. Very sophisticated taste. High quality hops gives very nice bitterness. 10% alcohol you feel only in your head, not in taste. When beer gets warmer in glas the taste is getting more interesting. To a jungle of tastes.
Bottle at Restaurang Treskillingen. Hazy orange colour with a large beige head. Aroma of hops, citrus, dried fruit. Sweet orange, apple, alcohol flavour.

Bottle 33 cl @ HBF 2013. Pours hazy murky brown copper golden with medium smooth tan creamy medium head. Very good notes of yeast , citrus, hops. Reminds me of some trappist beers in the yeastiness. This one is really fresh and refreshingly smooth.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours hazy orange in color with a cramy white head. I must say this feels super fruity, mostly some exotic fruits, fruity squares in a box mix and light notes of lemon in aroma. Feels really fresh. Some yeasty spicy notes in taste as well. Orange peel in aftertaste. Overall a very refreshing beer which reminds me of De Ruyck 125 jubileums beer.
Bottle at hbf 2013. Hazy orange color, big white head. Aroma of licorice, yeast, earth. Full bodied, hops, sweetness, strong flavors, yeast.

Yellow hazy Very full fluffy head. Fresh light slightly hoppy aroma. Taste is diverse, some bitterness medium sourness, citrusfloralgrass smthg. Dry sour long finish. A bit of alcohol burn on the finish but doesnt taste.
August 2010. From a 33 cl. bottle. pours cloudy orange with a white head. Aromas of orange zest, yeast and clove.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with light lacing and diminishing huge off-white head. A slow gusher. Aroma is very sweet with tangerine, dried fruit, fennel, pepper, red apple, bubblegum, pear, lemon,grass and honey. Taste is near heavy sweet , light acidic and a hint of salt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is near lively. Finishes slowly drying and warming with a lingering spicy flavor and pepper in the finale. Leaves a butyric flavour behind. This beer is a compressed flavour-bomb.

Bottle - 330ml. Cloudy golden body with a thin white creamy/foamy head. Good malty/hoppy aroma with fruity and yeasty hints. Alcohol is very well hidden. Its well balanced, complex malty/hoppy taste carries yeasty, fruity, and honeyish notes. Ends with a warming bittersweet finish. Very well done.

2010 bottle - no idea where I got it.  Murky gold pour with a sturdy white head and soapy lacing.  Aroma is big sweet toffee, citrus peel, belgian yeast, and pepper.  Tastes are candied sugar, apricot, floral hops.  Boozy in a good way.  Nice sipper - though I like some of their others better.

Courtesy of Nordcore, thanks!
Appearance: Orange brown, hazy. Ok amount of off-white head.
Aroma: Fruit, orange, lots of yeast. Some hops.
Taste: More fruit, hops. Yeast. Liquorice?
Info: 330ml bottle, 5/4-2013
Bottle 33 cl. Golden, clear with a white head.  Aroma of  yeast and bubblegum.  Sweet with a caramel end.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a tulip. Hazy, amber colour with a huge, cloudy white head. Fruity aroma with candid sugar, spices, sweet, ripe fruits, yeasts. Also alcohol and a good amount of malts. Vinous. Complex as usual for De Dolle. Taste is sweet. Full body, creamy to thick texture, lively carbonation. Finishes lightly bitter and warming with grassy hops, alcohol, sweet fruits and yeasts. Another great beer from De Dolle.

Bottle @ home. bottiglia non invecchiata. Il profumo è di frutta candita, ricorda in froma attenuata la stille nacht.  Si sente molto il lievito belga e ci sono note di caramello. Il luppolo non è molto forte al naso.
Colore ambrato intenso, un pelo torbido. La schiuma è ampia e poco persistente. quasi pannosa.  Allassaggio è dolce, ma non stucchevole, il luppolo è ben bilanciato con lalcol e si intensifica sul finale. il corpo è medio/denso. laftertaste è la sua carta forte. ritorna il dolce mentre scompare lacidità che si avverte a causa dellalcol. fantsastica, infine, la carbonatazione. 3 di queste e ballate sui tavoli. (anche a casa da soli)

Hazy burnt orange. Lively carbonation. Medium frothy/fizzy white head, fairly lasting. Aroma is earthy/wild yeasty, fermented fruit, some spice. First sip: so much going on! Medium body, crisp, effervescent, fruity, malty, a little hoppy, some spices, sugary/boozy finish. Lots of depth. Great balance. Great beer.

aroma is earthy, soapy, and slightly fruity.  
Medium body  Fruit, malts, hops. Lots of depth, each sip I discover something new.  Citrus, wine, spices, sweet sour candy.

33cl Bottle.
Appearance: amber, blonde beer. Off white head.
Nose: lemon, sweetness, some yeast.
Taste: hops, caramel, very dry, not really my kind of beer but made very good.
UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 Old tick, super carbonated beer, fruity, malty, slight alcohol tinge, decent tripel. Had it on draft recently, very sweet but very complex and robust.

Backlog review, Bottle, pours slightly murky golden orange color with very nice and lasting head. Good lacing also. Aromas of apples, candy sugar, Belgian yeast, winter spice, hops, honey and pepper. Flavor was just as awesome with notes of dark fruit, spicy yeast, barn, dry hops, and some clove. Medium to fuller in body with ample carbonation. Tried this bitch a good 5 times over the last few years and I truly believe its one of the best trips in the world.

Pours a murky orange with a lot of "floaties", Aromas of grapes, yeast, and citrus. Flavor is spot on from what I look for in a tripel. Light fruit, lively carbonation, and a slight alcohol burn. Considering I had never heard of this beer before I found it yesterday and out of curiosity, I bought it on a whim, I would consider this a world class offering. Even though I am absolutely loving this beer, the only odd thing I am noticing is the amount of yeast floaties in the glass. It looks as if someone poured black pepper continuously into my glass. Regardless, this is a delicious brew worthy of the rating.

Pours with the towering head expected of the style. Nice sourish malty aroma. Color is hazy orange. Tastes of spice (peppery), hops, and sweet malt.  beautiful to look at and even more beautiful to drink.

33 cl bottle, aged 7 months. Golden colour, some what orange when yeast is also poured in the glass. Big white head, stable. Aromas of yeast, dough, caramel and banana. Taste is a little sour in the beginning. Then sweetness, lots of yeast, banana, Orange, white pepper. Very subtile alcohol taste

I love De Dolle, but this was too much for me. Uber sweet and cloying. Obviously it has pedigree and a lot going on. Ripe, lightly funky nose. Full bodied. Candi sugar, lemon, sour apples, a bit more funk and a epileptic shock inducing finish. Good, but much prefer their Ara and Orebiers.

Pours a slightly hazy deep orange with white head of medium bubbles that lingers and has slight lacing.  Malt, biscuit and fresh grass aroma. Bready yeast on both aroma and flavor. Nice florals hops with alcohol throughout. Slight bitterness.

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100501.
Pours hazy golden color with a medium sized head. Aroma of yeast, fruits, caramel, some spices and hops. Flavor of spices, yeast, ripe fruits, caramel, some toffee and wood. Excellent.

Poured a clear amber with a huge frothy white head. Aroma of sweet dark fruit and spices. Medium body, quite lively. Flavour of citrus (orange), some raisin and plum and caramel malt. Bitter sweet finish.

Cask. Pours clear amber with average, creamy white head; decent retention and lacing. Aroma is cookie and caramel malts, floral hops, pears, light fig, and light herbs. Flavor is sweet malts forward with supporting floral hops and fresh fruit esters along with a hint of spice; dry, lightly sweet finish. Medium/full body and low carbonation.

33cl bottle into chalice glass. Looks appealing with a translucent deep amber body and a large rocky white head that settles to a firm lacing collar. I get 
oranges, lemon peel, candy sugar, pine needles, white peppers and alcohol on the nose and this is reflected on the tongue with a lively mouthfeel and medium-full body. Finishes sweet and a little sticky (certainly contrary to the stated description of 30 IBUs). A superior Belgian Tripel that goes down surprisingly easy given the high ABV.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Nebuloso color oro con uno spesso strato di schiuma bianca saponosa. Fantastica al naso, ricca di profumi floreali, caramellati e mielosi con sentori lievemente speziati; gusto dolce e imponente ma non stucchevole, note fruttate perfettamente intrecciate ad altre più maltose; ottimo equilibrio complessivo, finale lungo e rinfrancante. Corpo pieno, struttura irrobustita dallabv che non si dimostra però invadente. Forse la miglior Tripel mai assaggiata!!
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Smells of basement aromas, leather, caramel. Taste is sour, very yeasty, with a follow up of some sweet maltiness and a note of hops.

Bottled in 2010.  A fizzy, hazy light orange tripel with a lasting white head.  Notes of plum, orange peel, caramel malt and a hint of raisin. Yeasty spice.  Slightly tangy.  Mild bitterness and sweetness.  Boozy and smooth.

Pale orange colour, little hazy, and a thick head. Smells lemon and yeast. Taste is slightly peppery, some caramel and a bit hoppy. Dry finish.
It would be excellent, if the alcohol would be better hidden...but still great.

11.2oz bottle poured into tulip glass; pure Belgian deliciousness; I dont know why the bitch is mad -  Im not after thoroughly enjoying a couple; beautiful pale color; sharp up front; dry; maybe its more like a typical tripel as it ages, but not now; more like a Belgian strong ale.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 330ml bottle at BXL East. Pours a hazy golden yellow with a fluffy white head. Aromas of fruit, yeast and light citrus.  Taste is yeast, Belgian candy sugar, some hoppy bitterness and a bit of sweet malts. Good stuff.

On tap at high dive. Pours cloudy butterscotch orange with small white head. Aromas of bread, spicy yeast, some citrus and light fruits as well. Flavors of belgain yeast, spices, citrus, yeast, and bready malt base. Nice big triple. Not my favorite style but this was nice.

Bottle. Pour is hazy butterscotch with floaties and a small white head. Aroma and flavor are deep sweet orange malt, cane sugar, light spice, and faint Belgian yeast notes. Faint cereal malt in the finidh. Every time I have this beer, I think its going to be less sweet, but its not. Just not my thing.

33cl bottle.  Pours a hazy golden yellow with big fluffy white head that leaves light lacing.  Aroma is lemony and a little musty with a sweet background.  The taste starts off fruity with some pineapple and citrus, followed by the sugars and earthy malts paired with sour apples. Then a woody flavor creeps in before some more sugars, bitter hops, malt, and a peppery alcohol sensation. Medium bodied with a rich, creamy, slightly sticky mouthfeel. Carbonation is high, tingling the tongue and the back of the throat. Alcohol is hidden well in the flavor.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle dated September  2011 poured into a trappist glass.  Pours hazy with inch and half bright white head.  Good small bubble lacing, medium body, and light candy sugar aroma.  Taste is light candy sugar, doughy, some light citrus, and herbal hops.

33cl bottle from the Bier Paradijs.
Hazy amber pour.  Thick white head.  Nice brew.

Flaske tatt med hjem fra hytta: meget højt skum! Legger seg som en gardin på glasset. Syrlig (ananas?) aroma med sødme og faktisk en del bitterhet.Smaken likeså, og med en nydelig munnfylde og ettersmak. En spesiell tripel som jeg bare MÅ kjøpe flere av.

On tap at Novare Res Bier café after the yearly Zwanze release. Nose is strong Belgian yeasts, orange peel, tart fruit and a hint of some clove. Taste is a bit zestier then what the aromas lead me to believe. More bitterness in the finish then most Ive tried in this style. Does have a great doughy yeast backbone. Nicely put together triple if you are not looking for the standard in the style.

Draft at Redlight. 2011 Vintage. Hazy deep gold pour with a fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet angel food cake, bubble gum, banana esters, spices and a lot of complex yeast. Flavor is sweet bubblegum cream, cheese cake frosting, complex yeast and subtle spice. Medium bodied with that extra thickness to make it interesting. Delicious.

On tap 4 oz. sample at Pizza Paradiso, DuPont Circle in Washington, DC.

Clear amber with minimal head and lacing.

Aroma of fruit, grape, honey, raisins, pear, plum, caramel and yeast.

Taste of fruit, honey, raisins, pear, caramel and yeast.

Full/medium body and medium carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2012 goudgele troebele glasvulling. aroma die enorm sterk is: peper, biscuits, zoetig, brood, alcohol, citrus. 
smaak ; als eerste indruk pittig, daarna komen de andere tonen zoet (kandij) hop, matig bitter, behoorlijk moutig, citrus. iets teveel co2 gehalte. 
vrij lange bitter pittige afdronk, droog .

Nice golden and cloudy aspect with a tiny head but very good lace, marked and longlasting. Malts and pineapple over a resin hops. A very original triple, very interesting and complex. Need to taste it again.

Pours.  a light amber with a lacing white head. The aroma has the typical Belgian spice and sweetness. The flavor starts sweet with a lot of sugar then gets a touch of bitterness and some pepper. Lasting feel and a bit of warmth on the throat.
Golden colour with an amazing head, looks really good. Aroma is just average, but taste is excellent: honey, cereal, malts, alcohol notes...delicious. Drink it slowly and enjoy!

Spicy, dirty belgian aroma, almost crass. Beautiful big head with a lot of bubbles, really nice. Flavors of alcohol (almost like camphor), yellow fruits and spices again. Not much alcohol heat but you now that it is there. Better now that it has been aged for about a year and a half, the chunks stayed at the bottom of the bottle too. I believe this beer needs at least 18 to 24 months before it is ready, first sample I had was aged for ?? years but it was really good and I could never recreate that with a fresh sample. A mighty fine belgian when it is ready though. :)

Bottle from Blue Max. Murky dark orange pour with a white head. Light fruit, pear, yeast, candied sugar in this with a good crisp palate with nice carbonation and a bit of drying bitter hop. Excellent.

Bottle at home.
Hazy amber with white head .
Aroma: bananas, belgian yeast, biscuits, honey 
Taste of alcohol, biscuits, honey, sweet fruits 
Medium body and bitterness. 
Nice Belgian

Bottle:
From the old days in Belgium:
Medium to bigger sized fluffy white head on top of a hazy yellow golden colored beer.
Smell flowers, grains, honey, fruits, hops, yeast, spices, hay, some malts, herbs and something light alcoholic.
Taste is a fine mix of hops, citrus and lemon, grains, corn, malts, flowers, alcohol, warmth, spices, yeast, flowers, bitters, light creamy, some sweets and herbs. Well balanced.
Aftertaste is spicy with yeast notes, some warmth, some grains, floral herbs and hop bitters
Medium to fuller carbo, spicy light blown mouthfeel, good medium to lightly fuller body and a creamy texture.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
Kraftig aroma af fersken. Klar med fin skum. Smager sød, mørk, dyb, alkohol, vinøs, banan og pære. Prikkende og brænder lidt på tungen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

AROMA: bread, cereal, tea, alcohol, 
APPEARANCE: golden, clear, 
TASTE: lightly sour, medium bitterness, 
PALATE: full body, lively, sticky, 
OVERALL: too much alcohol ruins this, also the strange tea flavour does not add much; well-bodied beer.

Bottle from Sixteen Tons in Eugene. Pours a golden color with little head. Toasty notes are prominent in the nose. Warming is non-existent, this is a very smooth beer.  Sweetness is probably the most forward flavor, but this is incredibly well-balanced overall. Probably not my favorite beer ever, but can understand why it is so highly regarded.

Pours murky amber with high frothy head
Aromas of bananas, belgian yeast, biscuits, honey
Distinct taste of alcohol, biscuits, honey, sweet fruits
Medium body and bitterness. High alcohol and sweetness

Pours light orange amber, cloudy, with big white head. Aroma of belgian yeast, brown sugar, spices, earth. Taste is initially very sweet before a very alcohol rich finish (quite long). Body is full and creamy, low carbonation.

The Mad Bitch! Bottled 9/22/2011. Yeast and ester filled aromas: peaches, pears, citrus, grass and sugar. Opaque yellow-orange with half finger of last head. Tastes is overly sweet and tangy, like a sour tropical fruit. It has a very drying effect on the palate. Ab extreme tripel to say the least. Too much sugar and alcohol burn.
330 ml bottle into chalice. Hazy amber color, foamy white head. Some honey notes. Persitent aroma and flavour. Quite a complex beer, with medium body and medium sweetness. To try!

11.2oz bottle. Poured a hazy orange color, with a creamy white head. Aroma was yeast, notes of citrus, some sweet honey notes. Alcohol is pretty subdued for 10%. Nice yeasty character, plenty of citrus notes here. Good.

10/2/12. 11.2oz bottle from Grassroots. Hazy orange pour with a small off white head that fades and laces a little bit. Sweet, fruity, and slightly tart aroma. The flavor also hits sweet and fruity with touches of mint, herbal aspects, sugar, yeast, and touches of dryness that lingers.
Honey colored with a porous rocky white head; sweeta sugar and peach syrup aromas; creamy on th eotngue with a bitter oily finish and an alcoholic burn. Rich.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2012 
33 cl bottle @ home. Bottled 03/2012, BBE 03/2013
A strong kick of CO2 when opening the bottle. And foaming when pouring. Lots of foaming. Finally, when a big and a small Tripel Karmeliet glasses are full of foam, I can start my rating.
Aroma is somewhat sweet with toffee typical to aged Belgian ales. Also Belgian yeast, some citrus notes and grassy hops. Very foamy palate with lots and lots of CO2. Flavour is rather strong on pear esthers, some alcohol, banana and Belgian yeast. Dry finish. Interesting stuff; the alcohol is stinging and clearly present but still it doesnt disturb much. This has some similarities with Malheur Biere Brut.

Aroma is vinous, acetic, banana & cherry notes esters. Color is orange with particules in suspension. Frothy white head. Light body. Heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour.light body, slick feel, average carbonation. Feel like an old ale or a blend with an old ale.
Bottle bought at the brewery. This was one of my early favorites when exploring the Belgian scene - after two years of heavy hitters, this one is milder than I remember...

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy orange with nice white head. 
Aroma yeast, citrus, sugar, orange, tropical. 
Taste is bitter, sweet. 
Mouth-feel thin/creamy. 
Good triple!

Full carbonation. 3 finger head that lasts for 5 minutes without resolve. Deep, rich, tropical and honey aromas, mix with tangerine and spice nuances. Concentrated, ripe tropical and stonefruit flavors continue, with layers of honey, spice, yeast and dough. The finish is full of honey, dough and yeast nuances, reminiscent of a asian sticky bean bun. A very complex, rich, concentrated beer. 10% ABV well hidden. Needs time in the glass. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Pours a big frothy head riding a nice golden color.. great lacing. This beer is full of big Belgian flavors of spicy citrus, belgian candy honey sweetness, touches of bread, some floral notes and a amazing mouthfeel. Good carbonation and a great complex finish that has a touch of boozy goodness.

Pours a hazy caramel color with a huge foamy white head...lively looking...excellent retention and lacing.  Aroma is lightly sweet with candi sugar...lt citrus and faint leather.  Flavor is less sweet...mild earthy bitterness creeps in...some yeasty/spicy notes.  Mouthfeel is medium and livelty/silky with a dry, slightly spicy finish.

Bottle (330 ml). Clear golden with a beautiful small white head and some lacing. It would be a 4/5 without those big particles. Aroma of citrus (mainly orange), malt, spices and candi sugar. Taste of citrus (orange), malt and spices. Mouthfeel is dry. Nice complexity and balance. Good tripel!
Spicy aroma. A little sweeter than expected but nicely balanced by the hops, although the bitterness lingers a bit longer than desired.
330ml Bottle - Amber with a slight haze and a foamy head. Dried apricot, malt and hops in the aroma. Fruity, yeasty and slightly sweet taste with notes of apricot, lemon, yoghurt and malt.

Bottle pour. Nice hazy orange with a white foamy head. Bananas, cloves, orange coriander, bread, and rubbing alcohol in the aroma. Bread, orange, spices, alcohol, and the Goldings hops in the taste. The hops come on pretty quickly and linger.
