Bottle shared by Alexcg - Thanks! Pours golden with a white head. Fruity aroma with Belgian yeast and hints of hops. Sweet, malty and fruity with a hint of caramel. Slightly dry finish. Nice tripel! (2012-07-27)
bottle @ Gambrinus (italy). Pours amber with a great white head. Spiced aroma with a great balance between bitterness and sweetness. A great great beer.

From the bottle to a tulip. I always give these a chance to warm up a little out of the fridge. Nutty, caramel aroma with the head still attached.  When it fades away you will get some floral notes, a hint of booze, and some sort of herbal peppery scent but it is very faint.  Hazy brown-orange color with a great deal of particulate suspended in brew.  Ive learned that the "crud" floating is always a sign of a great brew.  Taste is sweet and a little boozy.  Boozy is pleasant, alcohol is chemical and unpleasant.  Nice carbonation, not too prickly and it actually seems a little thin.  Overall, this is the best tripel Ive ever had.  It is more malty and sweet-tasting than a typical tripel and doesnt offer the spruce aroma and prickly carbonation.  Probably best consumed in cold weather, but it did just fine right here.
Very enjoyable tripel from de dolle. Yeasty fruity aromas. Taste is a bit sweet with some bitterness at the end.

On bottle, thanks Alexcg.
Olden color, good foam.
Nice yeast, good fruit intensity.
Full body & high complexity.
Good bitterness, some sweetness.
Good carbonation & well bAlanced.
Very enjoyable

11.2oz bottle. Big foamy white head. Amber color, with lots of particles floating inside. Very creamy spiced aroma, some orange peel, banana. Very fine, tingly carbonation, dry finish. Belgian yeast aroma. Light bitter, light zest, light alcohol bite in the taste. Very interesting authentic Belgian Tripel, good to sip. Bite fades a bit as it sits and warms, beer gets smoother as you go. A good one to sip over a long period.

Bottiglia da 33 cl. : Dorata opalescente con un abbodante cappello di schiuma pannosa e persistente....naso intenso e complesso con miele, camomilla, spezie ed un leggero tostato...entra dolce e calda in bocca, di corpo anche se i 10% sembrano meno.....chiude in equilibrio fra il dolce e un leggero amaricante.....bella bevuta!!!

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2013 33cl bottle. Orange/brown and a bit hazy. It has this well established small to medium white head. 

NOSE : really fruity with tart aromas. Mostly orange peel with banana and cherry. Refreshing and a bit soapy overall aromas. Alcohol notes in the background. 
SIP : Thick body and low carbonation. Oily texture. Its sweet like tart. Yeast and fruits in the background : grapes, pear, apple. Strong clove.  The finish is deeper tart with booze and strong spicy notes. Little sour aftertaste that mixes with moderate bitter. Booze reveals itself after couple of sips.
OVERALL : strong beer with lots of booze. Body is thick and drinking it is both a great experience and quite a challenge since it will get you at least tipsy.

Golden pour with a very small head.  Clean mild fruit aroma.  Some sugar.  Big creamy mouth.  Taste is very strong with burnt sugar.  Bitter finish.  Kind of one note and little too much alcohol for my liking.

A: Yellow, straw hues, slightly hazy, gargantuan whipped meringue head, great retention and lacing.

S: Belgian yeast, spices, fruits, slight pleasant sourness.

T: A wonderful beer. I try and always keep a few of these in the cellar, though thats not easy because I like them so much and I can always go buy more. Dulle Teve has a fantastic Belgian yeast character with notes of spices and a light fruity character.

M: Good feel with a slight alcohol note in the finish.

D: If youre in the mood for a tripel, you wont be disappointed. Great beer.

Pours dark golden orange with a big white head. Nose is citrus, almonds, cardamom, coriander, ginger and hay. Taste is sweet with a good bitter presence. Mouthfeel is crisp and clean. Medium bodied with a long aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Versando questa birra salta subito allocchio lenorme schiuma che domina il bicchiere. Ma questa è una birra che non si ferma ad un bello ed abbondante cappello, laroma vira dal fruttato allo speziato, passando per camomilla, fiori di campo. forte e complessa anche al palato, con una forte presenza alcolica equilibrata da uva, malto.

At Memphis Taproom. Pours golden, bubbly off white head. Nose is golden sweet malts.  Taste is not very sweet for a trippel, apple, hints of honey and tartness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hell malziger, zuckrig süßer Beginn, dazu kommt eine deutlich oxidierte Note. Gewürzig, wobei dies in der Zuckernote fast untergeht. Leicht herb, trocken werdend, leicht bananig. Der Alkohol ist spürbar. Zu süß! /6/6/8/5/6

Bottle split with mcberko. Pours murky golden yellow/orange with a patchy white head, lots of carbonation and sediment. Aroma of Belgian yeast, hay, cereal, bread, and some rustic funk. Flavour is the same with some hints of spice too. Full bodied, highly carbonated, and spicy.

Bottle from Kris Wines. Orange-tan colour with a massive white head. Lots of sediment in the bottle. Aroma is spicy, yeast, alcohol and fruit, maybe apricot jam? The alcohol is a bit heavy on the palate. Taste is full on, following the nose, restrained bitterness on finish.
Nice aroma of honey and alcohol. The alcohol burn is a tad sharp, enjoyable malty flavour.

A - pours nice golden with some floaties. Very very high fluffy head. Strong clinging. S - strong Belgian yeasts and astringent. Notes orange peel, tart fruit, funk. M - strong sticky up front, fades to a flatter drier end. Malty sweet throughout, with a lingering astringent sting in the end. T - soapy Belgian yeasts up front. Flatter sweeter middle, apples, over ripe bananas, yeasts, soap on the palate. Lingering light astringent, sweet bread and sweet vegetal malts. O - interesting fruity bready Belgian. 7

Bottle from Etre Gourmet webshop. Pours almost clear golden with a huge frothy white head. Aroma of spicy hops, sweet fruity and yeast. Taste is first of all a very lively spicy mouthfeel, high carbonated, moderate alcohol burn towards the end.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Smells of basement aromas, leather, caramel. Taste is sour, very yeasty, with a follow up of some sweet maltiness and a note of hops.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar. Light amber with a fluffy white head. Spicy banana-heavy aroma, but something feels wrong. The aroma is muted and takes a lot of work to experience. Has the fuller body youd expect from a 10% beer but Im finding it hard not to be disappointed. Its not a bad beer by any stretch, but it falls somewhat flat here.

33cl Bottle, bottled Jan 2011. Drunk May 2012.
Amberblond, white head, not as lasting as usual.
Sweet citrus flavor, candy sugar, a bit acidic as well.
Taste is quite sweet/sugary, light bitter finish.
Easy to drink a lot, but probably a mad bitch the day after!

tulip. gold color clean body and massive head and lots of lacing. aromas are citrus, hay, yeast. taste up front is a bit sweet, not very bitter, yeasty, and lots of notes of hay and coriander. The texture in this beer is very interesting, at first I took a sip of the head and very fluffy texture and some of that feeling remained as I washed my mouth while drinking the beer. brilliant!

Sharp, sweet aroma.  You can small the sugar.  Pours a big head with big fluffy bubbles.  Leaves traces on the sides of the glass as the head dissipates.
Golden, with lots of particulate matter floating around.
Lots of carbonation so it hits the tongue a bit like a sour.  Dry finish.  
Ziggy start with a lemonish sour dry finish.  Maltyness really sticks around in the mouth with is interesting with such a dry finish.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head.  Smells of basement aromas, leather, caramel.  Taste is sour, very yeasty, with a follow up of some sweet maltiness and a note of hops.

Poured on draft into a whiskey tasting glass. Appearance is densely hazy yellow with a thick frothy head of white foam. Aroma is slightly tart, but a light sweetness is the more present aroma. In the taste I get an interesting salty sweet note thats oddly nice. Difficult to explain. Really good beer.
Goudgeel, veel kraag die lang blijft. Zoetzuur aroma.  Smaakt behoorlijk zoet met een lichtbittere afdronk. Volle smaak. OK bier maar iets te zoet naar mijn smaak.

From the bottle. Fruity esters on the nose with some honey present. Lots of carbonation with a foamy head, mouth feel is smooth almost chalky. Complex with some grape, spice notes developed as it warmed. Easy drinking considering the strength and well balanced.

Bottled September 2011.  Pours clear gold/amber with visible streams of effervescence and a 4 finger head that leaves incredible lacing.  Aroma is  candy sugar, herbs, berries.  Very hard aroma to describe.  Taste is somewhat vinuous in character with a minor acetic note mixed in among a meadow of flowers and the ever-present candi sugar.  Some bready notes buried within as well.  Body is light and super frothy with a massively expansive mouthfeel and a lingering spicy dry bread finish.  Overall, an interesting tripel.  Great brewery but this is perhaps my least favorite of the Belgian styles so you might say Im slightly biased against it.

Amber with foamy white head and tons of floaties.  Aroma of deep citrus, candied fruit, lemon zest, and basement must.  Flavor starts sweet citrus and fades to a moderate citrus/floral hop bitterness and light mustiness.  Mostly residual citrus hops.  Relatively dry finish.
Combines delicate acidity, bitterness, caramel and dryness together perfectly for a distinctive and unique triple experience. Absolutely superb.

UPDATED: AUG 8, 2014 April 2012. Draft at Eulogy. Poured a murky white amber with minimal head retention. Probably my favorate tripel with the perfect blend of sweet and bitter. Complex sugar notes with the right amount of stickiness balanced with hops that don?t so much bitter as merely offset the sweetness. Draft is more interesting than the bottle as there are noticeable variations year to year (and even keg to keg) but all versions are always good! UPDATE: Worth noting that the August 2014 drafts have a small but distinct cocoa flavors that was completely missing from earlier versions.

Bouteille de 33 cl, vieille denviron 1 an et demi. Arômes de levure fruitée et de pommes vertes, base maltée très "grainy". Robe dorée, quelques particules en suspension, effervescence active et très belle mousse. En bouche, la bière montre un caractère malté très particulier, montrant une présence de tanins provenant des grains. On a réellement limpression de mettre son nez dans une cuve dempâtage. La levure typique de De Dolle contribue des esters fruités et des notes de pommes vertes. Finale maltée où pointe lalcool. Intéressant.
UPDATED: DEC 4, 2013 Again a lovely brew from the Dolle brouwers. Very complex triple beer. Sweet, fizzy and a bitter finish. Complex brew!

Dulle Teve rebaptisée triple pour le marché US ... (puritanisme oblige) Une triple oui pour la couleur, pas trop pour le nez et encore moins pour la bouche ....
Expliquons : pour le nez on a au déaprt de la crème fraîche, du beurre frais, du croissant, chocolat blanc et de la vanille. Tout cela est bien, mais na pas grand chose à voir avec une triple....
La bête est annoncée à 30 IBU et cela se sent à la première bouche. On a utilisé du Golden hops, voilà le résultat. Donc intéressant comme entrée en matière. 
Dans la seconde bouche, on sent tout ce que lon avait au nez au départ de la dégustation : de la vanille  (!!) , pain blanc, beurre....
En troisième bouche de la banane douce.. Encore une fois, rien à voir avec une vraie triple... 
En conclusion, certes on a le degré alcoolique à 10 % abv, mais il ne
soutient rien de valable pour le genre ....
Et en plus, étonnant pour les Dolle, la levure est, dirons-nous, un peu légère ...
En bref, si vous cherchez une vraie bénédiction, cherchez-la en 
"oerbier et arabier" (urbi et orbi). Dolle mousse teve bis cum...

Che Tripel, ragazzi. Al naso si presenta con un aroma fruttato (banana, che si nota di più quando si riscalda), a tratti mieloso e con un tocco di uva passa. Al palato risulta corposa, vinosa, anche qui torna un pò di miele, con lacidità del succo di mais (quello dei barattoli). Punte di dolcezza con un sottofondo di amaro. Finale persistente. E matta e lasciva (generosamente e ottimamente per ciò che offre!) come recita letichetta.

31/12/2011 Bir&Fud Bottega (330ml bottle). Ambrata, lievemente torbida, con buona schiuma bianco sporca, abbastanza persistente. Aroma fruttato, lievemente acidulo, con note di lievito e malto. In bocca è moderatamente dolce, abbastanza complessa, con una bella nota amara finale e un lieve acidulo. Corpo medio, gradazione alcolica importante, consistenza oleosa, correttamente carbonata. Eccellente!

Pours an almost clear amber orange with dark floaties and medium white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma of caramel, sweetness, and herbal hops.  Flavor pretty much matches, but odd bitterness stops this one from being much better.

33cl bottle from Kihoskh. BBE 09/2012 I think. Poured hazy deep golden with a frothy white head. Aroma is yeast, hops, some alcohol and perfume. very complex. Flavor has oranges, hops, alcohol, peppery spiciness. Very dry finish with salted liquirice. Complex, enjoyable, huge beer.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2012 Dark golden color with a white head. Aroma contains some spices, biscuit, lemons, herbal notes. Flavor is very smooth like lemon meringue pie and some spices. This isnt a mad bitch but an easy going hippie chick. Aftertaste is somewhat sour. Overall very good.

33cl bottle. Murky orangish with a frothy, large and creamy off-white head that quickly diminishes in a thin layer. Nice lacework on the cup. Aroma is fruity, slightly citrus hints yeasty and moderate malty. Flavour is yeasty, sweet, strong alcoholic, slightly caramel and moderate bittery with a long final. Carbonation is medium to high. Body is high.

Pours an unclear and copper beer with a large offwhite head. The aroma is malt, sweetness, yeast, fruit and sugar. The flavor follows the nose with additional alcohol. The palate is sweetness with alcoholwarmth. Overall a good beer.

A slightly orange, copperbrown beer with a big and beige head. Aroma is fruitfull and aromatic, oranges, spicys, fruitfull sweetness, yeast and some parfume. Taste is fruitfull, surprisingly, lot of herbal bitterness, lot of spices, alcohol is present and it gives strongness and also hint of it can be taste. With yeast the beeer is more rounded as typically, but generalise nothing is changed a much. Medium+ bodied, lots of carbonation and slightly biting to drink. Strong and complex, herbal spicy Tripel, good.

330 ml bottle into chalice, bottled July 2010.  Pours cloudy golden orange color with a huge 2-3 finger foamy off white head with fantastic retention that reduces to a thick cap that lasts.  Some nice lacing clings to the glass, with plenty of carbonation streaming up retaining the head nicely.  Aromas of big lemon, orange peel, pepper, apple, grape, apricot, banana, candi sugar, bready grain, and spicy yeast.  Very nice and well balanced aromas with good complexity.  Taste of big lemon, apple, grape, apricot, pepper, banana, clove, candi sugar, biscuit, tart grain, and yeast spices.  Lingering notes of apricot, lemon, pepper, clove, biscuit, yeast spices, and tart grain on the finish for a while.  Nice balance of flavor with nice complexity.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a nice creamy and slightly slick mouthfeel.  Alcohol is well hidden with only a slight warming after the finish.  Overall this is an excellent, complex, and well balanced Tripel.  I would have this one again.
Smelled of burnt essence.  Uber head on the pour.  A mediocre tripel that I wont go for again, but far from the worst.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2012 bottle at bateau de nuit, qc. hazy golden. bread. acidity. fresh cereals. light to med hopping - grassiness. light aged caramel malts. honey layer. lively and soft carbonation. medium body - silkyness. short to med long finish. very nice!
birra fantastica, gusto dolce(ma non troppo),deciso e forte, abbastanza corposa. La de dolle migliore se non esistesse la stille nackt,a cui si avvicina molto! :-D

Bottle served in a tulip. Hazy golden orange with a ridiculously large head. Excellent retention and lace. Very aromatic nose of yeasty spice, lemon, clove, funk, and banana. Strong yeasty flavors. Light sweet and funky. Medium body, creamy texture, bubbly carbonation, and a long yeasty and bitter dry finish. Im loving this strong tripel. Complex from start to finish.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2012 fantastica,la migliore dopo la birra di natale de dolle..aroma dolce che ricorda frutta,palato speciale:dolce,caramellato,fruttato con un retrogusto luppolato finale..davvero superba..

Bottle 33 cl. Pours clear deep aber with a huge beige head leaving lots of lacing. Aroma is sweet, caramel, acidy, floral, malty, spicy, cumin, fruity and alcohol. Flavor is fruity, sweet, bitter, pungent, malty, dried fidges, vinous and alcohol; very nice. Finishes bitter, sweet and malty.
Huge white head, dissipating. Amazing floral, fruity, aroma. Sweet taste, toffee-esque, warming, great balance, hop taste but.doesnt feel bitter. Really nice.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2012 A: Pale orange body.  Large, off-white head.  Spotty lacing

S: Mild soft fruits -- apples and oranges.  Nice spicy, Belgian yeast notes.

T: Like the nose, there is a nice, mild, restrained fruity complexion.  Semi-sweet apples, a little orange pop in the finish.  Black pepper, pale malt and assertive yeast notes.  Complex and interesting.

M: Smooth and well-balanced with a nice effervescence.  Spicy, crisp finish.  

O: Another standout beer from De Dolle.

33 cL bottle from ABS Drinks in Winksele into a Westvleeteren glass.  Was in the fridge for 45 mins to get down to cellar temperature.  Nice bubbly head over a fizzy amber beer.  Fine spiced malt aroma with candy, smells great.  The tasty is rich, liquid treacle! Luxurious, with a candy bitter sweetness, excellent.  This was a real treat.
Ottima birra dal colore ambrato. Schiuma di persistenza media. Dallodore presenta chiari tratti fruttati che si sprigionano in bocca già dal primo sorso. Da provare e da gustare lentamente.

Very powerful aroma, culture, yeast, a prominent aged cheese. Even unripened bananas come to mind on the nose.  Pours an auburn colour, with a soft head that melts to white lacings.  A remarkable flavour on the palate.  I wouldnt hesitate to have this one again, just not all the time.

330 mL bottle from SoHo Organic Market in Elizabeth City, NC (bottled May 2010).  Hazy yellowish-orange pour with a frothy off-white head.  Aroma of tangerine and light candi sugar.  The flavor is lightly fruity, tangerines come to mind, but is heavier than many tripels on the candi sugar and the flavor of alcohol.  Medium bodied, slight alcohol warming.  A very good tripel.

33 cL bottle at Bar Volo, served in a snifter. Pours hazy golden with a moderate, dense white head. The head remains and leaves a small amount of lace. On the nose, there are notes of sweet fruit, sour apple, straw, citrus, yeast and a hint of clove. Wow, the flavour is huge! It begins moderately sweet and slightly sour with lots of fruity notes. As it develops, it becomes somewhat more sweet with yeasty and floral notes. The finish is long with loads of malts and some spice. On the palate, it is medium in body with a dry texture and lively carbonation. Overall, this is a great tripel. It has a surprisingly strong flavour and a nice spicy malty complexity with adequate hops in the mix. Definitely worth another try! 2011-12-19

sweet fruity notes, with a touch of sour apple, straw, citrus

11.2 oz. bottle, pours a cloudy golden with a towering white head. Aroma of Belgian yeast, oranges, candied apples, citrus, and some noticeable hops. Flavour is intensely yeasty, with loads of citrus, funk, oranges, dry apple / pear, candied sugar and alcohol. Highly carbonated without detracting from complexity. Finishes dry, yeasty and citrus hoppy. Delicious.

Beautiful deep gold/straw like pour with a vibrant white head and nice lace coating the glass. Bags of citrus, caramel and hops on the nose. Bitter, sweet, dry and fruity on initial sip. Bags of carbonation and lemon, hint of spice and grapefruit with slight red/yellow pepper heat. Awesome triple. I wish I picked up more than one......

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is like Tripel concentrate... very strong aroma and taste. Color is quite dark for a tripel, but head and lacing are nice. Taste is excellent, but strong. Excellent beer I want to spend more time with.

Bottle 330ml at Biero. Masterpiece, great balance. Aromas of caramel, biscuit, and butter. Taste is sweet, with sour notes, and very long length. Palate is syrupy, and full bodied. Amber, with a frothy head.
Flaske 0,33l på t Brugs Beertje 3 Mai 11. Gyldenbrun. Pent luftig skum. Syrlig fruktaroma. Litt gjærpreg. Søt fruktig smak. God. Lett syrlig ettersmak. Litt uvariert. Masse bunnfall i flaska.

11.2 ounce bottle purchased a year ago at Sun Devil Liquors in Phoenix ($6.99).  Pours a rusty reddish amber hue with really big fizzy white head.  Aroma of French toast made from yeasty bread, caramel, vanilla, some candied dark fruit, and butterscotch.  Flavor is full of rich sweet caramel and brown sugar as well as lesser notes of Belgian yeast, fruit, and spice.  Quite sweet in a good way but not cloying.  Rather full bodied for the style.  The 10% ABV is barely noticeable save for a little chest warmth.  Overall a great tripel that appears to have aged quite well.  (1013, 641)

One of my all time favs. Served at a great temp with a grand, billowy, soft, foamy, frothy, fluffy, off white head that sits there for a while before burping and lots of clingy lace. Color is a clear amber with loads of bubble trails. Aroma is yeast on top, then malt, vineous. Flavor is like nose with lots of yeast bitterness followed by hop, just a little sweet, good carbonic tang, white wine, apples, pears, hint of funk. Body is champagne like, expansive, yet of substance and carbonation is out of sight. Finish is like flavor, without flaws and lingers pleasingly with a friendly alcohol warmth. Dont know of another tripel like it. Delightful beer from the Mad Brewers!

Bottle at Aba-Jour. Cloudy amber colour with big white head. Aroma is predominantly boozy and sweet. Bit of caramel. Taste is same, extremely sweet and you can feel the alcohol. Very chewy and quiet full bodied. After taste gives a bit of biscuit, but everything struggles to get past the overwhelming booziness. My least favourite De Dolle beer, but I love De Dolle, so that is not a criticism. This one is maybe just a bit too strong and sweet for me.
Very tasty, malt heavy, strong blonde, hint of citrus. Could have a bit less alcohol and carbonation for my taste.
Golden hazy body, big white head. Deep aroma of peppers, saisonlike yeasst, pineapple, bananas, alcohol and some yoghurt. Flavour has alcohol, vegetables, smoke, strawberries. Round and fullfilling.

330 ml bottle. From bierkompass.de.
Deep hazy golden colour with ridiculously huge white head. 
Belgian yeast, pepper, mild smoke and Russian salad in interesting aroma.
Hops, yeast, smoke, alcohol, sweet caramel, sugar, vegetables, spices and Russian salad in flavour. Warms a lot.

fruity yeast ester nose with some goldings dry spiciness. Pours a hazy amber with exuberant carbonation, like a mini geyser which continues til the end. Fairly prickly, peardrops and sugar soon replaced by ethanol and perhaps some additional alcohols with a sweet malt finish
Clear blond colourec beer with large white head and full carbonation. Hoppy herby aroma. Full sparling palate. Finsih is hoppy herby with some spicy roasted touches.

Bottle 330 ml 
Aroma solid, aromatic leafy dry  character, grapes, alcohol and some raspberry. Slight finishing funk. 7+
 Appearance  hazed amber-gold , medium creamy top. Sparse lace. 3+
Flavor and Palate : Dry carbonation, green feel of skin grapes followed by alcohol. Some softness of wheat. Very refreshing, crisp ale. Very nice.

Bottle...33 cl.. pours hazy golden with a large creamy long lasting white head....  the aroma is very fruity, yeast, oranges, hops and some acid... the flavor is very nice :) malty, yeast and spicy very fruity... nice mouthfeel ends with a bitter hoppy finish..... very nice beer!

Hoewel tripels niet tot mijn favoriete bieren behoren, kan ik de hoge waardering van dit bier niet helemaal begrijpen. Amberkleurig, licht troebel bier met een mooie volle witte kraag. Smaak en geur hop, zoet en bittere nasmaak.
Hazy gold in color with a huge and foamy whitish head. Sour with a hint of bitterness, some citrus and spice in the mix.

Bottle @ home. Cloudy orange appearance with a lot of suspended sediment and a big white head. Pretty spicy yeasty, bready, citrusy, lemon, spicy aroma. Very spicy, potent yeasty, orange citrusy, belgian yeasty, tangy, light candy sugar, bready flavor. Very assertive tripel.

Yay Im the 1000th rating for this one.  Pours a hazy oranger color, mediumsized beige creamy head.  Aroma is of smooth fruits, yeast and spices. Flavor is yeasty, fruity, slightly hoppy and a bit spicy.  Has a bit of booziness but is still well balanced and pleasant.
Beautifully complex beer. Aromas of citrus, candy, ginger, maybe even some sweat (in a good way!). Massive frothy head out of the bottle that hangs around. Alcohol is very well hidden.

Hazy light amber yellow, firm lasting white head. Quite some chunks of depot in the bottle. 
Aroma of malts, lots of citrus, yeast, hops, candy sugar, pepper, surprisingly little alcohol in the nose for the ABV. Flavour of malts, fresh hops, some pronounced bitterness. Good tripel qualities. Good bite, full body. Long, light bitter finish.
(From 33cL bottle)
En botella.Buena  corona con buenos encajes,aromas a levadura,alcohol,especies....citrica,dulce y alcoholica.final amargo y citrico con retrogusto dulce.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Also bought from the brewery, an hazy amber coloured brew with an smoothly bitter taste and some hints of apples.
Embotellada Gen 2010. Color tèrbol, aroma lleugerament dolça, carbònic relativament alt, entrada dolça, final sec. Densa, lleugerament alcoholica i llarga. Gran cervesa.

33cl bottle at t Antwaerps Bierhuiske. A cloudy golden ale with a huge white head. Nice spicy tripel nose with lemon rind, pepper, candy sugar, alcohol and caramel. Similar flavours of candy sugar and lemon. Alcohol is fairly present with a long hum. Finish is toffee, caramel, white pepper and lemon again. Heavy carbonation and moderate CO2 prickle. Not bad.
Pours cloudy yellow with a huge white bubbley head . This is a sweet yeasty masterpice that over walms you with citurs flavors. Triple should stand for 3 times as happy. Must drink in this style.
Pours cloudy yellow with a huge white bubbley head . This is a sweet yeasty masterpice that over walms you with citurs flavors. Triple should stand for 3 times as happy. Must drink in this style.
From the bottle. Poured like apple juice with a frothy head. Smelled like apples, lemon, caramels. Tasted sweet, mildly bitter. Lots of yeast in the aftertaste.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2011 In bottiglia allIrish di Quinto; beverinità fantastica nonostante i 10°, Elena ringrazia ancora
Did not like this triple.  Smell is ok because it just smells like apple juice.  Taste is fairly sweet with notes of stale bread.  Just kind of a sweet mess of doughy flavors with notes of apple.
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2011 Smells just just like a fresh glass of motts apple juice. Bread and yeast flavors dominate, some spices. That bready yeastiness is a fail for me.

Pour golden orange with lots of items in suspension ridiculous white head. Aroma spice, hops, earthy, honey, bready, yeast. Taste spicy yeast, bread, strong malt, honey, earthiness, grassy, lemon, coriander. MF medium body crisp carb. Tasty tripel with some nice kick to it easy to drink abv well hidden.

Pours light golden color, who cares. Way...way....way overcarbonated. One fourth of the bottle fills a 12 oz glass with mostly foamy head that lasts a very long time. If you can manage to wait for it to subside, youll have a really nice ale to enjoy. Nice balance of malt, spice, slight sweetness, and a touch of fruit. Finishes very well, with lots of nice aroma coming up through the nose. Good one.

2010 bottle.  Almost a gusher...still going like champagne in the goblet...solid standing finger of foam over the top of the glass (of three fingers of foam).  Anyway.  Very strong hefe flavors.  The candi sugar comes through on the after and brings along some of that 10% abv.  Ridiculous banana on the front, not necessarily cloves on the after but spicy.  Just crazy nice carb...looks like ice cream now the bubbles are so damn small.  The fact the carb is still going crazy as it slide down my throat helps kill of 1 point on palate.  Would love to hide one of these away for five years.  The carb is still going crazy +/- 5 min later.  Not necessarily what I think of as a tripel.
Bottle @ home. Standard yellow / golden color. Not the best smell but a decent lightly fruity, lightly bitter and lightly sweet taste. Firm carbo and medium body.

This excellent tripel pours with a huge off-white head that never fully dissipates. Aromas include lemon, yeast, coriander and clove. Flavor is citrus and spices with a nice interplay of sweet and bitter on the tongue.
Aroma is aloe vera, birch, yeast and citrus. Taste is osimilar with dry finish.

Purchased from Belmont Station in Portland, OR while on vacation.  Poured cloudy golden color with monstrous head and fine lacing.  Aromas of caramel and yeast.  Taste is quite sweet with little hop bitterness in the finish.  Great carbonation and moderate body provide a nice mouthfeel.

On tap at the Nook. Pours birght yellow with a medium white head and great lacing. The aroma is lemons, fresh cut grass, lavender, coriander, and bread dough. The flavor is citrus sweetness initially, with a noticeable but mellow bitterness. The palate is heavy, thick and creamy, and very lively and effervescent. The finish is long and mildly bitter, with the astringent hop acid feel lingering. Overall, this is a very well made, balanced beer with a magnificent mouthfeel and subtle, delicious flavor.

33 cl bottle from Brussels. Hazy, yellow liquid with huge white head. Aroma has notes of cloves, light malt, belgian esters, alcohol. Taste is quite dry, medium-heavy bitter for the style. A bit sweet. Light to medium bodied with high carbonation. Very nice for the style, less belgo than usual. Very nice, not as sweet as most tripels. Very balanced.

Slight hazy dark golden with a huge and lasting white head. Aroma is quite sweet, malty, fruity, yeasty and spicy. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with warming alcohol. High carbonation. 250711

Amber hazy body with a huge white head. Great aroma of brown sugar, licorice, yeast, lemon, orange, spices, caramel. Sweet flavour with caramel, some alcohol, orange and spices with a hoppy underlying tone making it very balanced. Excellent.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2017 Jotakuinkin kullanvärinen olut kaatuu tulppaanilasiin De Dolle -panimon Dulle Teve-pullosta. Valkoista ja melko paksua vaahtoa muodostuu lasiin paljon. Tuoksussa on purkkaa, mausteita, hedelmäisyyttä, makeata mallasta. Dulle Teven maussa on hedelmiä, mausteita ja purkkaa. Erittäin kuiva tämä on ja hapankin. Melko runsas. Nautinnollinen kokemus. Alkoholi pukkaa kohtalaisen paljon läpi ja se varmasti haittaa osaa oluenystävistä, mutta ei minua juurikaan.

Bottled a year ago.
Pours amber golden with a huge but disapering white head.
Aroma of bananacandy, 
Rather sweet taste of strawberries, fudge and a hint of licorice.
"Foamy" mouthfeel.

Bottle looks a bit complex, but okay. Beer in the glass zippy, dry aroma. Starts strong, fine fruity, almost with a light salty touch. Finish still dry, modest bitter, some lemon notes. A bit alcoholic-warming. Very nice!
light flower aroma,golden, clear, white foam, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice spicy,alcoholic and flower finish.
Mi sono innamorato pazzamente di questa tripel mad bitch, in una notte dinverno, aroma meraviglioso e gran bere...
Dark amber with a thick head. Champagne, apple aroma, with some malt. Sweet and sour taste, triple-like, but the alcohol is very well hidden. Great aftertaste, all making atruly great beer

0.33l bottle courtesy of and shared with ClubGonzo. Pours a cloudy orange body with a massive fluffy everlasting white head. Aroma is quite yeasty with some citrus, cactus and dry grapes. Medium-bodied, average carbonation level and has a oily texture. Sharp yeasty and yeasty flavors with that dried-fruit note these brews often have. Ends light warming from the relatively high abv, with more of that typical Belgian yeast profile and light spicy aftertaste. Quite a nice tripel from De Dolle!
The smell of this beer was a bit off. Glad it tasted different than it smells, since taste it pretty decent.

Pours a cloudy orange with lots and lots of bubbly white head.  Nose is fantastic: very fresh scents of cloves, oranges, and belgian yeast.  Flavor is similar, with a unique, honey sweetness as well.  Probably the best Tripel Ive had to date and very refreshing.  This is my first foray into De Dolles line, and its encouraging (but potentially detrimental to my wallet).

330 ml bottle.
Pours a slightly cloudy golden colour with a large white head. Aroma of sweet caramel malts, fruits with earthy notes. Flavour of toasted sweet malts, sweet fruits, spices, yeast and some sour notes. Medium bodied with a thick mouthfeel and a lovely warming, dry, fruity finish. Made for indulgence.

Bottle from EtreGourmet, shared with Palme. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange body with a massive creamy head. Great looks. :-) Aroma is strong Belgian sour-ish yeasty tones (distinctly De Dolle yeast profile on this one) with hints of oranges, citrus and muscat grapes. Taste is sour yeasty tones again, mixed with sweet pale malts, alcohol and hints of grapes and orange peel. Surprisingly enough, theres little madness in this bottle, and I expected a much more aggressive tripel from De Dolle. Still, this is a very, very nice beer.

Enormous bubbly head over a tasty looking hazy orange. Barnyard, orange juice, hay, sourdough bread and leaves. Different from most Belgian trippels; not as sweet-yeasty. Bitter start and a more sweet-sour finish. Theres lots of flavour but something I dont like about this beer, not sure what. Maybe its the changing character or the - in my opinion - too high ABV for the taste. Or do I have a bad bottle? (33cl bottle)
buona birra abbastanza liquorosa un pò amarognola poca schiuma. Non è il mio genere ma tanto di cappello a questa birra.

Hazy golden with a three fingers thick, off-white, creamy head. Spicy Sampler at CBF 2011-05-26. Belgian yeast, cloves and flowers on the nose. Heavy sweet and alcoholic. Full body. Sweet juicy finish.

Bottle at home. A nice dark honey color with a good head. This tastes a bit heavier than other triples, probably because Im sensing more malt. A strong flavor of dried fruits. Alcohol flavor is evident, but not overpowering considering 10%abv.

330ml bottle enjoyed at t Brugs Beertje. Soapy, white head with a solid stand. Copper coloured body, almost clear. Spiced fruity aroma, somewhat wheat-like. Lemony hops with spices and bread-like malts in flavour. Yeasty fruitiness to the ending. Masked alcohol. Medium bodied. Pleasant (Brugge, 02.05.2011).

Obstig auftretender Geruch mit dem Hang zu Weintrauben und Aprikose. Fruchtig im Start, leicht hefig. Dann hart einsetzender Aromenschwall nach Ananas. dazwischen immer wieder nussig-malzige Einschübe. Im Mittelpart kommt eine staubige Holzigkeit hervor und die Alkoholnote setzt wärmend bis in Abgang ein. Leicht bedeckt herb-mehliges Finish. 
Überzeugt voll und ganz! Test vom 14.1.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Bottle. Hazy orange pour with a big head. Aroma of musty yeast and oranges. Very sweet, almost too sweet, but balanced by the spicy clove and esthery notes behind the toffee and pepper.
Draft. Light gold color. Little head. Smells of lemon, bread and dopugh. Ytaste s similarbut sweeter. Easierto drink then the abv suggests

Pours orange with a very large white head and some floaties. Aroma has so much orange, lemon zest and apricot. Very fruity. Passion fruit also. Its different from a hoppy fruitiness, you can smell its coming from the yeast. A decent amount of grassy hops as well. Taste has a lot of the same fruitiness from the aroma, adds peach and pineapple to the mix, i love the yeast in this one, a hint of alcohol and a but of doughiness. Lovely!

Pours hazy orange with thick lasting white head, a bit gushing out of the bottle.  Aroma has notes of lemon, honey, some fruity apricot, mandarin orange, spice, some slight bread.  Complex, fruity, very nice aroma.  Taste has notes of fruity orange and lemon, lots of spice notes and yeast driven dryness, with much more bread and doughy pastries, with a slightly bitter and dry finish.  Different than any other tripel, but good stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 2013:
i find this still an awesome beer, aroma has so many sweet n soft cherries, how could i have missed this the first time!? also, the warming finish and great full mouthfeel deserve some attention


red brownish, beautiful and tough looking beer, great big tough head.... aroma has cheese, bread, malts, something medicinal... tastes bittersweet with mandarin, citrus, honey, some weird sweetness which i cant place (could be honey)... the finish is long and sweet... it feels very lively, but it has something old in it also... very nice and special

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a huge dense white head, lots of small bubbles. Aroma of yeast, citruss, grape, spices. Taste is sweet malt, candi, belgian yeast, fruit and spices, light alchohol. Full body, soft carbonation. Good one. 080511

33cl bottle in a private beer tasting. It pours a hazy golden/amber liquid with tiny yeast spots and with a very high white head that lasts throughout the beer and leaves some lacing. The aroma is mainly hoppy, floral, with spices, some citron and grapes; very nice. It also has a malty base that gives roundness to the nose. It tastes (surprisingly) quite different: very parfumed with citrus and floral hops, it is mainly malty, very toasty, with burnt caramel and a even little hint of coffee. It is very bitter, with medium body and a little too carbonated for my taste. It prickles the tongue with its 10% ABV and the excess of carbonation. With a better palate, this beer would be groundbreaking. Cool presentation (it needs a customized crown cap, though) for an original and curious beer.

Rating #540, bottle from Vinspecialisten Islands Brygge  

It starts out great with a really appealing apperance. The beer has a dark amber look that is totally opaque and looks almost petrified. Theres yeast fragments slowly floating around in the amber, and the head looks like whipped cream. Beautiful! Aroma has yeast, alcohol, apple, pine, glucose, malts and spices from the hops. Flavour is sweet and alcoholic with some peach, yeast and an overwhelming bitter finish for a tripel. Palate is soft and has a medium thickness. This is a very alcoholic and bitter tripel, which afterall is not very tripel like, and even though it is a fine brew it would suit it better to have more floral hops and less alcohol.
Not sure of the age of the bottle because this tasted really old. Would like to have another again soon.

Was this really a triple, it sure didnt taste like it, it reminded me of an old or a traditional ale, it was very strange, I wonder if ours was possibly infected, seems likely but im not holding my breath. Overall not terrible but certianly not something I am going rush right out and buy again

Shared a 750mL with Goob. aroma of bread. banana, doughy, alcohol. Flavors of smoke. finishes with hichory. golden orange in color. very bitter and very dry. goes much better with food. probably a smoked pork tenderloin or spicy thai.
I really like the finish of this beer, its good and wont buy it again, it if i could

The fizziest looking beer I have had without it all spewing out of the bottle. Light amber hue. Huge white head. The head is easily half the fill of the glass. Obvious lacing. Citrusy and banana aroma. Malty and peppery. Sweet clove and malt taste. Slightly banana-y. Dry, sweet, highly carbonated. Nice beer, but a bit too much on the sweet side.

330ml Bottle at Home 31/12/2010 (Thanks Craig Garvie)
Yeast and malt aromas. Carbonation. Golden coloured strong in alcohol fruity and a little sweet on the palate. A hint of dryness and bitterness in a hoppy warming malt finish.

11.2oz bottle in a Trappist glass.  Pours opaque golden/brown with a lacy, thick, off-white head.  Aroma of spicy yeast, caramel malts, sweetness from the sugar, and very light hops.  Flavor about the same - very sweet for a tripel.  Silky, thicker texture.  A really good tripel.
Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is belgo yeast, orange candies. Flavor is yeasty/spicy, fruity, herbs, and very sweet. Finish is rich and malty.

di un bel color arancio,non molta schiuma,leggermente aspra,sapore tipico di una tripel,si sente parecchio lalcol,ma nonostante non sia il mio genere di birra,non dimostra i gradi che dichiara.buona.

Bottle 330ml @ home
[Trade by Dedollewaitor] Pours hazy golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, oranges, sweet malt and some yeast. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and light bitter with a sweet alcohol finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

330ml bottle.  Pours dark orange with a large frothy head.  Aroma is banana, clove, yeast with some icing sugar sweetness.  Taste starts with yeast and banana.  Dry, clove and yeast finish.  Nice and full in the mouth.

28 March 2011, bottle. orange/brown, slight haze, occasional bubbles. interesting. slightly tart red fruit, slightly barnyard saison w/ some alcohol aroma you expect from a tripel. full body and mildly fizzy. much more like a tripel as far as flavour goes. slightly tart but has the typical yeasty, alcohol flavours, though with some background barnyard straw notes. pretty decent.

Shared bottle at BrewDog Edinburgh. Gorgeous clear amber, with a decent white head. Some retention. Aroma is citrus, Orange, some yeast. Really quite interesting. Taste is dry, light malts and plenty of spice. Almost sour but not quite. Bitter, clean, crisp aftertaste. Very nice.

Draft tulip @ Bavarian Lodge. Hazy golden color. Head has fallen in, but this is the end of the keg, and I asked for it. Smell is faint to my stuffy nose, just a suggestion of sweet tripel malts. But not as sweet as the tripels I usually get. A dry pinot finish supported by some hoppiness.Im pleased to find the dryness sticks around, with a bit of leaf spicesage, maybe. I like it much, but just wonder if some of what I like is just yeast from the keg bottom.

The Bartender gave me a brandy snifter to drink to pour the beer into.  Smelled of citrus, a little lemon but mostly orange.  The carbonation was high and suits the style well.  The taste was mostly of bread and yeast.

Serving: 330 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors.  It pours a hazy, deep gold color with a large and well maintained head of foam.  Sheets of lacing get left behind.  The nose has notes of bubble gum, honey, candy sugar, and perhaps a slight underlying minty hoppiness.  The flavor starts light, gets sweet with lots of bubble gum notes, then hits you with a nice yeast note, dries out and is gone leaving just a hint of malt on the tongue.  There is something I cant quite place too.  Perhaps a bit of Anice or some sort of herb.  Sort of a basil, tarragon, mint mix.  Light to medium in body with lots of carbonation which adds a cleansing effect leading to a dry, slightly herby and pale malt finish.  Really a joy to drink.  The alcohol is completely hidden.  If I didnt know better I would say it was 4%.  Wow.  I will definitely hold on to one or two to see how they change.

Bouteille de 330ml. Embouteillée en juin 2009 selon la capsule. La bière coule avec une forte effervescence qui sestompe rapidement, la mousse disparait peu de temps après sa formation. La bière est dorée. Les arômes de houblons et dépices sont bien agréables au nez, une touche de caramel est aussi perceptible, la bière a vieilli tout de même. En bouche la bière a du caractère, elle est très facile à boire, digeste, mordante, lamertume est marquée. Complexe. Léquilibre entre les épices, les houblons et la levure est tout à fait divin. Très bonne bière. Merci Patrick et Viper.

New Beer Distributors, NY 11.2oz ($5.60): Pours a sediment filled, cloudy orange color with a prodigous white head that lasts forever. Aroma is yeast, yeast, and some more yeast of the basement or earthy variety. Also the fruit aromas are in force here. With the taste you get moderate dry hops. Plenty of sweetness and of course a little bit more yeast. Doesnt taste like any other tripel Ive ever had, but still tastes quite good. Alcohol is perfectly covered and the mouthfeel is exactly as it should be. I could probably drink ten of these without really minding. I love De Dolle.

On draft at The Ale House in Amsbury, MA. This came a cloudy golden yellow with a white head that left spiderweb lacing behind. The nose is citrus rinde and grassiness.  Body is medium, and mouthfeel smooth. The flavor is very Belgian with sweetness, fruit, and lots of flavor. Hides the high ABV well. Very drinkable.

Cloudy golden colour with a huge off-white head. Fruity malty aroma with notes of citrus, fruit and a hint of yeast. Malty, fruity flavor with tropical fruit and a spicy finish. Full body, with some alcohol sweetness.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: started out somewhat sweet with lots of yeast+ hop & spices and oranges, was than followed by a very bitter hop taste with a slight hint of booze, the aftertaste was very harsh & lingered on in a very enjoyable way, I can see myself returning frequently to this one, bottle had some yeast ssediment, I tried eating iafter I finished the bottle but that wasnt such a good idea, tasted like bitter mud, the structure was truly unsettling, worse than the still acceptable taste // increased score from 4.2 - 4.7 incredible brew ///// Tried many more times, no notes but continues satisfactory experiences. Continues quality confirmed.

Pours hazy amber with a growing sudsy head.
Nose shows doughy yeast, candi sugar, light fruit (pears, white grapes) and soft phenols. Yeast really dominates here.
The flavours, unfortunately, are completely dominated by hot, solvent-like alcohol. Underneath is more doughy yeast.
Carbonation is way too high.

330ml bottle from Rays in Wauwatosa.  No date on bottle, but a fair amount of sediment so I can assume this bottle has been sitting for a while which may effect its taste and my rating.  Golden amber color, with lots of carbonation and a steady head of medium sized bubbles.  Tastes a little tart with bready yeast and nice effervesence.  Clean on the palate with a little linger but a mild bit metallic on the back.  Overall better than bad.
Color is that of a brown sun.  Has some nice sweet sugary smells.  Taste is a bit sweet and sour!  Some fruit (apples) are also in the taste.

On tap at the local option. Pour is cloudy golden. Frothy white head that produces cobweb like lacing all over this abbey glass. This brew feels quite traditional, in a good way. Orange rinds, lemongrass on the nose. The flavor profile is similar; but the Belgian sugars are certainly present here. What you dont quite appreciate is the 10% abv. Very smooth and medium bodied for what this is.
Poured a hazy yellow with a white head.  Aroma of cheese, hops, veggies, pale malts, yeast.  Quite complex in the aroma.  Taste has veggies, pale malts, and a hoppy finish.  Overall pretty good.

11.2 ounce bottle picked up at Capones.

Pours.a light rusty tan win a two fiber white head and some spotty lacing as it goes down. Nose brings forth caramel, toffee, candied sugar, apple, and some figs. Taste brings it all together quite well and adds in a bit of an alcohol bite. Feel is a bit light all things considered. Drinks nicely and is very well done.

Amyliz4 gives it an A.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 10-07-2010
11.2 oz bottle, pours hazy copper w/ huge white foamy head, aroma is sourness, tannins, some barnyard, flavor is soft wheat, burnt sugar, slight sourness, pleasant alcohol warmth on finish, very nice
Bottle. Hazy golden with big off-white head. Flavour is malt, sweet, spices, bitter and yeast.

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2014 Pours hazy brown/orange with a big white head. On the nose I got ripe fruits, a bit candy, orange peel and fruity belgian yeast. In the flavour I sensed again the ripe fruits, belgian yeast, and orange peel along with some subtle port notes and some sourness.

bottle, pours clear honey, massive head, sorgham molassas aroma,candy sugar, some pine. flavor is sweet, citrus, grapefruit, sugar, some alcoho, caramal, vanilla. medium mouthfeel, maybe my favorite tripel

UPDATED: FEB 28, 2011 15/01/2011 - 33cl bottle @ a bar in Kortrijk (2011-20) 
Dark yellow to orange beer, creamy white head, adhesive and stable. Aroma: hops (Duvel), yeast. MF: lots of carbon, medium to full body. Taste: fruity, some sweet malts, hop bitters, spices and yeast. Aftertaste: grapefruit, citrus fruits.

A real treat. I like the aroma- I get a bready, malty, sugary almost cotton candyish aroma spiced fruit. Color is golden-red-amber. Taste is malt with dough, spice, figs and raisins, with rye, toffee, banana, honey and a slight alcohol. Palate is delighted with fruit spice and bread. Overall great beer, I love most De Dolle offerings so this is no exception.

Bottle, bought from Brewdog.com. 

G8 label and bottle. Really love the graphics here. Stunning. 

White lacing which diminishes quickly leaving a golden red-glow of a beer sediment is there but not too much and very easy on the eye. 

The aroma is shit loads of candi sugar, fudge, marzepan, hey and toffee and caramel. Taste is burnt toast, caramel, toffee, fudge cake, some bubblegum, really nice balance, stunning mouth feel, wow really wish this was a local pint as i would love to session this next to Crouch Vale amarillo, the sparkles fly out at you like the most orgasmic fizz-bomb your mouth can tolerate. really epic mouth feel this, one of the best palates Ive experienced, incredibly velvety off the tongue and a lovely burnt caramel finish which leaves me gasping. This is glorious and a stunning Belgian beer. VERY happy that this didnt gush all over the place so great handling by those brewdog scamps.
medium sweetness, orange, hazy, cloudy, frothy, lightly bitter, creamy, lively
Balanced, alchool is not separate from the body, tasty and full of flavours. One of my favourite beers...

Cloudy, dark, orange-gold with big, frothy, white head / Very faint nose of orchard fruit / Medium to full body, sweet and sticky with some tartness, fat with soft carbonation, with good balance and finish / Flavors of candied orange, clove, cinnamon, jasmine, coriander, and a touch of funk / Well made, but a touch overbearing and cloying.

On tap at Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà, its a very good job of De Dolle. Very good Belgian triple. Hazy yellow color with white and persistent head. Low carbonation with apple taste, all in all fruity. I appreciated it a lot. The alcoholic graduation was not noticeable too much, especially at the beginning.
5th November 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Nice crisp creamy malts that reminded me of Tripel Karmeliet. Distinct banana nose and taste as well. Strong and tasty.

330ml bottle @ One Pint Pub, Helsinki

Heavy, full bodied tripel with high carbonation and mild bitterness. Fruity and spicy, alcohol warms nicely.

330 mL bottle.  Hazy orange with a small white head.  Spice, orange, and candi- sugar in the nose.  The flavour is very complex, with fruit, lotsa caramel, bread, brown spice, and citrus.  The body is full, with medium-low carbonation keeping out of the way.  Pleasant sweetness in the finish.  Gotta get me more of these.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Aroma is of spice, fruit and a touch of alcohol. Flavors of spices, yeast, light apple, dark fruits, and some alcohol.

33cl bottle, hazy dark orange color, huge collapsing white head, yeast and dark fruits (raisins) aroma, caramel and coriander notes, spiced sweet flavor with hops notes, medium to full body, dry finish with spices and alcohol hints

Forgot who brought to the Houston Tasting. Pours a hazy yellow-gold color with white head. Interesting lacing. Nose of yeast, crisp pear and apples. Taste is crisp and enjoyable with medium carbonation.

Poured from a 330ml bottle a hazy ark orange color with a huge white head that lasts. Also plenty of dark sediment floating around. Aroma is of baked bread, caramel, vanilla and fruit. Flavor is unique due to the slight bitternes from the hops and is followed by an exceptional malty finish. A very unique belgium triple.

Pours hazed dark orange with lots of chunks. Large beige head recedes pretty quickly. Aroma of dough, caramel, citrus, dark fruit, some tart berry. Taste is sweet, lots of dark fruit, bready again. There are some hints of banana and clove from the yeast.  Awesome beer. Incredibly flavorful and a great texture. The alcohol barely shows on the finish.

Found randomly at a fromagerie in Flemish Belgium (in which case, it wouldnt be a fromagerie, now, would it?). Pours perfectly into a chalice, with a huge imposing head and an orange body with a storm of carbon bubbles. Aroma is a faint mix of malts and corn, citrus notes. Taste is a mix of paint thinner and cashew nuts, smooth pine-ish hops. Dry finish with the alcohol well hidden. A decent brew but lacking complexity for a high-alc concoction as it is.

Bottle. Orange  light brown, hazy, average and mostly lasting white head. Moderate malty and fruity sweetish aroma with spices (aniseed, coriander), some licorice. Body is medium to full, malty and sweetish flavor, spicy just as the aroma. Finish is average, malty and dryish, alcohol and spices make the finish feel more drier. Quite a lot of spiced triplel, but together with 10% alcohol it works and makes the finish pleasantly dryish.

Bottle 33cl. A cloudy yellow amber beer with good head. Smell is on agrumes and spices. Aroma is very wheat like, very bitter, not really sweet. Astringent with a strange spicy and wheat finish. Not very complex, quite basic triple, bit disappointed.

Thanks to Chalsk for this bottle.  I felt like I hit the circus before this bottle.  One of the best tripels Ive had.  Pours clear yellow with nice rocky white head.  The lacing is fantastic on this lingering head.  Aroma is alcohol, spiceness, yeast and hint of citrus.  Taste is a very understated sweetness that leads to a dry finish.  The alcohol brings out some warmth helping along the spiceyness.  Smooth
Syrlig, frisk, fruktig. Tydlig alkoholsmak och med en ganska kort och torr eftersmak

(Gracieuseté de Viper666).  Le liquide dévoile une robe orangée et embrouillée.  Une tête mousseuse blanche sinstalle pour un court moment.  Au nez, les notes épicées de la levure sont faibles et laissent un espace adéquat à des parfums chauds de fruits tropicaux et de pomme.  Les grains maltés en sourdine sont mielleux et bien accompagnés par des notes de bonbon sucré et de caramel doux.  Le goût est formidable : un amalgame de douceur et de notes surettes avec des touches florales de houblons et dalcool.  Quelques touches légèrement poivrées chatouillent la langue.  En bouche, le liquide démontre avec étonnement une belle et bonne rondeur avec une effervescence justement parfaite et une texture douce.  En finale, de petites notes de fruits sucrés précèdent une légère amertume de houblons et de levure qui se complète dun alcool insidieux et chaleureux.

Creates a big head when poured, which settles to about a quarter inch thick. The beer itself is unclear and honey colored. Light fruits, honey, light caramelly notes, yeast and some alcohol. Interesting, but missing out on the spiciness I like in my tripels. Also a little too much yeast.

Drank from the bottle at the Rabbit Club, NYC. Pours an orange yellowish body with a creamy white head.  Nose is lemons, spice, and yeast; Flavors are lemons, yeast, spices and a little bit of sweetness.  Finish is billowy light.
Cloudy orange-brown with big fat yellow head. Strong, pleasing aroma of citrus zest. Smooth and tingly, nice flavor - clean and rich. Good!

330 ml bottle shared at The Royale; he got it at Wine and Cheese Place, though.  This was the last of about 6-7 tripels we tried on a Tuesday night tripel event, and it was probably the best of the bunch (close with Tripel Karmeliet in my mind).  Pours a hazy dark orange color with a big, frothy off-white head.  Aroma of Belgian yeast, honey, candi sugar, sweet malts, and butter.  The flavor is also very sweet, malty, yeasty, and buttery.  Some nice spices balance it out.  Very dry.  Medium-bodied, with a lot of soft carbonation and a malty, buttery mouthfeel.  Alcohol is totally hidden.  Very impressive tripel, indeed.

Bottle, thanks to Doodler. Man I love de Dolle, but this one just didnt grab me that much. Pours hazy gold, medium pillowy cream-coloured head. Nose is lemons, cream, spice, ginger, creamy yeast; Flavours are ginger, sherbet lemons, garam masala, cream. A damned fine Tripel.

I won this bottle in a raffle when I attended the GALS (Georgia Ale & Lager Sirens) meeting at the Brick Store Pub in Decatur. It pours a hazy, nearly opaque honey golden with a fairly thick white head. (Be careful when opening, though - the sample I got fizzed like champagne!) Strong, inviting aroma is fruity and a little malty, as well as subtly sweet. Rich flavor is mainly fruity, mostly apple with hints of banana and pear. There are also malty and hoppy undertones and a little bitterness. Texture is smooth as soymilk and has a good fizz to it. Definitely worth looking for, but as I said, open with caution!
Very much like the Maredsous 10 but  a slightly less strong aftertaste. Great Tripel.

Bottle.

Hazy golden with a thick white head. Spices, yeast and some pepper in the aroma. Tasty, "soapy", yeast, some apples, good and not so heavy as youd think, however, I felt that there was some strength in the background.

Smells mostly like ,sweet malt, and yeast. A bit bubbly, good lacing, kind of looks like muddy water though. Hops and malt and yeast and sweetness, The sweet is a bit stronger than the rest, then the yeast. The % lasts the longest. Not bad, wouldnt seek it again.
UPDATED: JAN 20, 2015 Very good tripel. Dryer than I was expecting. Like all DeDolle beers very carbonated. Serving: Bottle

Weird I didnt review this one earlier. Pours out orange coloured with a hugh head that holds beautifull. Smell of caramel, some hops and some fruits. Also some spices seems to come up. Its a bit hard to smell something, but that what you can smell is good. Taste is pretty well balanced. Some sweetness, sourness and biterness seems to play in my mouth, with the sweetness making the most noise of the 3 at the same time. Spices, some fruits, banana and caramel comes up. Really good brew, I think its one of the better tripel Ive tasted. Maybe just slightly to much sweet-bitterness. But that makes the beer so tastefull, much better then so many water-beers. The end is dry biterness.

This was very good.  I tasted numerous fruits in this one, but the ones that stood out were banana and pears.  It smelled like champagne when I took my first drink.  For as high in alcohol content this beer is, it was light as a feather to drink.  I could see myself drinking more than one at a time.  Only downfall this beer had was the floaty fermentation.  Great Tasting triple give it a go!

I didnt really enjoy the first half of the bottle. But after pouring the second half into the glass, with all the sedimenty stuff and unfiltered bits, it was rich, complex, and remarkably textured - - the color was layered in the glass.  I think next time Ill buy six of them, let them stand upright for an hour, then pour off the top 2/3 of each bottle into one decanter, pour off the bottom portions into another decanter, then make them both part of a tasting along with other tripels.  I know for sure what will win.

One year aged bottle. 11.2 oz. 08.03.10
pours murky dark orange with a huge fluffy white head (most likely from the Belgian candy sugar). The nose is candy sugar, honey, light hops, light caramel, clove, slight banana, and peppery spice with a slight Belgian yeast. The taste is toast, light caramel, moderate banana and clove, dank hops, slight pepper, slight honey. Overall more sweet than anything else. The honey and candy sugar are very prominent and the hops and usual tripel tastes are dulled behind the sweetness. The alcohol has been dulled with aging and the 10% is hardly noticeable (no burn). Another great De Dolle beer (Still Nacht and Oerbier Reserva are still the best). This is great too though :)  Forgot to mention that it exploded with carbonation but I managed to capture most of it. After everything settled I was left with a velvety, creamy mouthfeel and sticky lacing on the glass. Great beer, one of my favorite tripels!
Pours hazy golden with thick, frothy white head.  Aroma of spices and fruit.  Taste is sweet with candied sugar, Belgian yeast, peppery spices, and sour apples.  Decent.

head: large, white 
colour: orange/gold 
smell: sourness, candy , hops ,malts, salt, hops, banana, bit like sauternes! 
taste: highly carbonated ! , sweet in start , melts out to malty , alcoholic background , end is weat bread and dry !
Nice heavy head. Smells sweet and of alcohol. The taste is just a little alcoholic, but just a bit too sweet. Nice caramel flavor though. Solid beer.

Pours dark blonde with a bit of rust and a giant, foamy, off-white head. Nose is very sweet and mostly fruity (Id liken it to red apples) with a touch of coriander and belgian yeast. The taste is more spiced than a tripel normally is and has almost a slight peppery quality, but its not overpowering by any means. The usual sweet candied sugar and fruit abbey malt is present. Not much in the way of hops. Finish is quick and sweet. Not a bad beer by any means but fairly bland and unimpressive for the style and pricetag.

Pours out with a brown/slightly orange body and a fluffy carbonated cream colored head.  Aromas are sweet and slightly earthy with a bit of a grassy sweet character.  Mouthfeel is a bit thick and carbonated.  Rather sweet flavors, notes of honey, toast and grass.  A slight bitterness offsets the sweatness.  Finishes out with a light bitter aftertaste.  Strong flavors, great bottle to split.

Grubby orange with a cream head that fades to a good coat. Aroma of winter oranges, meadow grasses, earth and a little white pepper/ clove/ nutmeg. Quite prominent alcohol. Taste is sweet sugary orange rapidly overtaken by spicy bitterness. Great creamy mouthfeel lifted by remaining carbonation. Light on the yeast angle - perhaps it might shine more with age taking the hops down a bit. A little astringency and alcohol burn at the end. A very nice drop.
heavy malty, wine, brown sugar, alcohol, yellow,cloudy, tan foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, acidic,medium body, sticky, lively, long finish,

Bottle pour to Trappist glass gives dark amber cloudy color with huge billowy off-white head that lasts forever.   Aroma fruity, acidy.  Tastes a bit tart with  dark fruits and mild alcohol.  Clean finish.  Very carbonated.

My least favorite De Dolle but more because of the style than anything else.
Aroma vinoso, fruttato, intenso. Schiuma decisamente ma poco persistente, colore giallo intenso/ramato. Complessa, strutturata, alcolica.
great balanced Belgian Tripel.  Mild citrus beer with a fruity finish. I need this beer on draft!

Aroma- first thing i think of when i take a whiff of this beer is starfruit,; sweet, aggressive, assertive nose with some light bready pale malts. 
Appearance- Pours a hazy gold with an incredibly fluffy, dense, and pillowy white head that never seems to go away. 
Taste- Sweet fruits... maybe pineapple? The aforementioned starfruit really stands out here, bitter and tart. Theres also a nice layer of spiciness that I cant quite put my finger on. The finish on this beer is incredibly long and bitter, with a touch of that belgian yeast coming through (bread, dough, and pie crust)
Palate- The carbonation on this beer is great, it is very lively and dances in your mouth as you drink it. 
This was by far the most interesting tripel ive had, and i thoroughly enjoyed it!
Yellow with a fragmented head. Nice fruity aromas with further notes of spices. The flavour is sweet with a spicy finish. The overall impression, however, is disturbed by a burning alcohol sensation.

Cloudy golden pour light white head ... light aroma of fruits and light belgian yeast..... sweet fruit and sour apple taste with a spicy bite to it yeasty with some malty mouthfeel.... bitter spicy hop finish ....overall not a bad tripel with an awful label

Hazy amber/orange color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of yeast, clove, some banana, & fruit; Flavor of slight sweet malt, yeast, fruit, hops, citrus, and spice; Alcohol at the finish; Nicely balanced & complex; Overall, an intense but good abbey.

750 mL bottle, corked & capped...I am pretty sure that I purchased this bottle in 2003...funny thing, it actually has the 33 cL bottle label on it, but it is indeed a 750.  After popping the cap, the cork immediately began to rise out of the bottle on its own, within 2 minutes of watching it, I was able to pull the lightly molded cork out with my fingers and I was rewarded by a loud pop.  That is the first time I have been able to pull out a cork with my fingers and the beer wasnt completely flat.  Pours a perfectly clear gold with an almost impossibly thick, creamy starched white head, that grows unbelievably quickly.  Dense lacing left all around the inside of the glass.  Biscuity, pale malt aroma, with a perfect amount of sweetness...with touches of honey, ripe apricots, warm dough and lemony hay.  Beautifully developed palate...what I can imagine as a once highly over-carbonated palate has mellowed into a velvety tingle across the tongue, delivering touches of bitterness, lightly warmed malts, and sweetness in a perfect balance.  I have been burned on some long-time aged beers recently, but this one, which has been staring me in the face for many years now, was worth the wait...the Mad Bitch has certainly become the Magnificent Beauty...it only took 7 years.

UPDATED: NOV 24, 2012 330mL 2009 ed into tulip. Last two Ive had were all gushers! This one was not for some reason. Pours a clear then hazy pineapple juice yellow with a towering white head that has excellent retention and very good lacing. Aroma of pineapple, fresh sweet rolls, banana bread, candi sugar, yeast, sarsaparilla/root beer, white pepper. Taste is a bit boozy, dry, spicy, powdery. Fairly bland for such a complex aroma. Disappointing. 4/30/2010 8/4/7/3/13=3.5750mL 2004 ed. Super rare tick thanks to ryan! Pours full hazed orange. Enromous head. Insane retention and sheets of lacing. Nose is minerally, celery seed, dusty, estery, moving to very fresh lemon and orange peel air freshener. Even some squashy hops and candied orange. Nice. Taste is dense, mild sugar, yellow apple, apple pie, spices, very rich dessert character. Clean, yeast forward, spicy. No cloying, no booze, no off character. Not even that minerally. The bar for Abbey Tripel. 11/24/2012 8/5/7/4/15=3.9

UPDATED: APR 30, 2010 Bottle.

A - A clouded, golden brown honey color. Small, foamy, white head that disappears instantly leaving no lacing behind.

S - Plenty of ripe golden fruit (apple, pear, melon, pineapple, tangerine, some peach and apricot). Some spice and Belgian yeast along with some candi sugar, honey, and a hint of vanilla.

T - Good amount of lighter malt and golden fruit (similar fruit smell to the smell), along with some sugar and vanilla. Mid-sip, more fruit comes out along with a fair amount of spice (clove, coriander, a touch of pepper, and a faint whisper of cinnamon and coriander. A touch of alcohol sneaks in, but it is very well hidden. Well balanced beer. Overall, slightly sweet but balanced.

M - Medium body with medium to low carbonation. Very smooth and creamy beer.

D - Good drinkability. Solid and balanced Tripel. Easy on the palate, but also quite stimulating to it. 

Notes: Vintage 2009. Pretty good Trippel, but not necessarily my favorite. Well balanced and a solid offering of the style. Alcohol is well hidden and there is a good mix of flavors. It looks like I may have been unlucky and got a bottle with something wrong with the carbonation (no real head). Still fairly good offering though. Worth a try, but nothing special.

Poured into my Chimay chalice.

A-Body is a very cloudy dark gold with some amber hues. Pours with a nice 2 finger creamy white head which fades to 1/2 finger and has perfect retention. Traces of lacing are left behind in the glass.

S-A Belgian candy sugar like sweetness comes through first followed by so sweet yeast. Floral hops and a touch of alcohol pack a big punch at the end.

T-Upfront are flavors of exotic fruit such as mango and peach...maybe some pineapple and a big sugary sweetness. Behind this is a healthy yeast backbone. A big punch of floral hops come through for the finish along with a touch of alcohol bitterness. A slight alcohol warmth lingers.

P-Low to medium carbonation and very smooth, creamy, yeasty body. There is an alcohol consistency in there too though, so beware.

O- Let this warm a bit before drinking it. Its downright awful and boozy when its cold. Once it warms a bit plenty of more complex characteristics come through and this one really shines. A pretty good beer overall.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 12-05-2008 03:33:28

33cl bottle. Pours orange with a small white head. Very little lasting foam. Aroma is malty with grain and hoppy with resin and herbs. Some spiciness too. Flavor is sweet and acidic, then turning to bitter. Sweet warm finish. Medium/full body with creamy texture. Soft carbonation. Very good beer, but I expected something more from this.

Bottle, tfs Vaiz! :D
Orange amber, medium head.
Aroma is fruity and yeasty, a bit sharp.
Flavour is very intense, hoppy bitterness, fruity sweetness, liquorice fullness, rich spices. All evolving smoothly ans lasting very long. Awesome tripel.

Bottle, thanks for sharing dEnk! Clear deep golden pour, foamy white head. Aroma of fruits, malts and some alcohol. Not very outspoken. Flavor is very intense, fruity, malts, some alcohol, peppery, spices and loads of carbonation. Complex and very nice brew.

Draft at redlight redlight.  Pours a cloudy gold.  Very pretty.  Big white head, minimal lacing.  Ok nose with some citrus, some spices.  Maybe a slightly doughy yeast aspect.  The flavor is really what will blow someone away.  The spice gets really big and delicious upfront.  Pretty sweet with an ever so slight tanginess in the finish.  Lasting doughy aftertaste keeps the mouth watering and craving more.  Fantastic beer.

Had this on draught at a special Belgium event at Chappys in Dayton -- served in a special 6 oz wine-like tasting glass. Dark golden color with a little head that recedes quickly. Fresh fruity aroma. Sweet candy tones with malty flavors of dark fruit, plums and raisins. Sweet malty notes with a lemony tartness in the finish. Full bodied, light carbonation.  Of the 4 Belgium beers I had this night, although all were good, this one stood out the least.

It pours light brown with a decent sized white head that quickly fades into a small half finger sized ring. Very good carbonation with tight knit bubbles. Not much lacing. The aroma is of hops, light fruits, brown sugar, maple. Its very sweet with a subtle hops backbone. The taste is very sweet at first and then leads into a nice bitter hoppy ending with a slight warming sensation from the alcohol at the end.

Pours cloudy dirty blonde color with a nice white head. Strong sour and bitter aroma, raisins and candied dates. Nice mix of flavors, a little sour to start, followed by a nice sweetness from the sugars and malt. Full body, a little dry, overall a very enjoyable beer.

Bottle thanks to Boutip. Beautiful golden/orange body with white head. Aroma is strangely soapy, yeasty, alcohol and berries. Flavor is mostly citrus and grain with a clean apricot ester finish. Palate is creamy and lively carbonation. A very enjoyable and solid brew.

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2012 33 cl bottle, pours muddy golden with a minor white head, aroma of candy sugar, yeast and slight alcohol, taste consists of malt, yeast, sugar, slight alcohol and is slightly spicy, decent finish, solid overall.

bottle. pours a golden yellow color with tons of carbonation and white head. aroma is of hay,grass, and alcohol. taste is sweet, and a hint of bitterness, and floral notes. this beer was similiar to champagne. over all a very good belgian.
Shared this one w/ SkyCop32. Pours a hazy medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty, hoppy, yeasty. Flavor is moderately sweet, highly alcoholic, citrus.
Bottle from bleeng Pours a deep cheddar with an aroma of skunky cheddar.  Flavor is a molasses bomb that exploded in a molasses factory.  Average mouthfeel.  Too old.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text:
UPDATED: OCT 11, 2010 I saved this beer for my 100th rating... Im glad I did too. Poured a cloudy orange/amber/gold (beautiful) with a thick off-white head. Aroma and taste: alcohol, sweets, spice, fruit, yeast, floral and malt. Excellent body, depth, complexity and balance. Overall: Excellent.
Note (Mid-July, 2010): I just bought a box of this beer (bottled May, 2010 on caps) to cellar... plan to open one (or two) every year to see what happens with this brew over time. Right now, it is much like my original rate... with more spice (pepper), not as floral, alcohol is a pronounced but not distracting, maybe more hoppy.

Pours a dark slightly hazy orange color with a huge amount of bubbly offwhite head.  Aroma is champagne and oranges.  Flavor is mild floral hops up front with dry slightly sweet medium bodied middle and a semi sweet grassy floral hop finish.  Enjoyable.

Bottle. Orange colour with a huge white head. Fruity aroma with notes of apples, malt and yeast. The flavour is quite sweet with fruits, malt, yeast and spices. Medium-bodied, hint of alcohol in the fnish. Very tasty tripel.

330ml Bottle. Orange in color and slightly hazed wwith a thick white head that dissipates to a short thin head completely covering the beer. floral yeasty aroma, peppery and spicy. Quite a nice hop profile. Light bodied, creamy and delicate on the palate with a lively carbonation and finishing dry.  Nice fruity flavors with some hop bitterness and yeast notes. Overall one very nice Tripel!
user_location: Cape Coral Waterfront Wonderland, Florida, USA

text: 330 ml bottle. Hazy golden body with a big white head. Aroma is grapefruit, cane sugar, spicy, yeast and alcohol. Flavor is sweet, spicy, yeast, fruit and warming alcohol. This is a very good tripel.

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur ambrée-orange et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes de poires vertes, traces de bananes), moyen dépices (léger de poivre doux, petites notes de clou de girofle), moyen-léger de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches) et floral,  léger de sucre bonbon ainsi que des notes de pain et dalcool. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort et un peu croustillant ainsi quune texture moyennement crémeuse.  Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes sucrées, léger de poire vertes, notes de pêche, traces de pommes verttes et de bananes) avec un léger goût épicé (poivre doux, traces de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un moyen goût de sucre bonbon avec un léger goût de pain et des petites traces de caramel sucré et de miel puis en finale lon retrouve une moyenne-légère amertume de houblon herbeux (herbes fraîches et mouillées) aux notes florales ainsi quun léger goût dalcool.  Post-goût moyen-long et légèrement sec, moyennement amer dalcool, de houblon herbeux aux notes florales avec un goût de levures fruitées (zest dagrumes, notes de pelures de pommes)

Pours a hazy gold color with a nice white head.  Aroma is malty and fruity, nice grapes and yeasts, lots of resemblance of champagne.  Flavors of malts and hops, fruity, grapes, grapefruits and light oranges, vanilla, yeast, honey and spices.  Good carbonation, slightly sweet and nice bitter dry, yet creamy.  Great ballance and complex flavors.  Very fruity, very enjoyable, great brew.

Bottle.  Cloudy yellow pour with a massive thick white frothy head.  Aroma of yeast, hops and sugar. Great taste of citrus, yeast, spices and faint barnyard in the background.  Nice even, medium bodied finish that hides the ABV.  Simply fantastic.

Hazy golden color with a large white head. Good lacing. Aroma: Very strong fruity hops, strong alc, malt, caramel, dark fruit, spicy. Taste: Strong alc, good hop bitterness, very sweet, spicy. Pretty good beer.
Great tripple. A little darker in color than in most trips but amazingmalty hop flavor. Grapefruit clove and pineapple on the palate. Must drink if you can find it.

Bottle...  Poured, hazy golden/orange with an easy forming, giant, white head.  Aroma of candied sugars, acidic-like yeast esters, and a mild earthiness.  Lots of carbonation and rich with sugars that played off of the yeast and alcohol.  The malted grains pitched a nice soft tone to balance.  Earthy hops and leafy tones before a slightly bitter, and tangy finish.
Bottle shared by texasjeep at the Feb Houston RB tasting. Very hazy and yellow with suspended . yeast. Nose is lemony and yeasty. Taste is the same, and is very carbonated. Good drinking beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text:
Red-brown transparent beer with a weak head. Citric, salty woody, peppery smell. Somewhat musty.
Rather dry bitter taste. Sweetish bitterness with a full bodied woodiness. With hints of cumin.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2011 33cl bottle
Pours a hazy golden color with the most espresso like steamed milk white head I ever saw.
